MKbAfpYSStS9mnOzQiQ6KA.text: I love this place. I work at the business park behind this place. The food is fresh and tasty. This is the best mediterrian place in the city. Fast and friendly service.

DF81KAvqKc0wd97y0JxrvQ.text: I've been eating here since March 2013 until December 2013. This place is soooo good! Yummy food and they remember my name. :D  I've been eating at their place everyday. :)  Food is fresh. Salads are great. Service is awesome. Everyone I talk to, I tell them about this place and that they should go. :)

Yh7SIO0xGmmcy0Ksm4B4fQ.text: 5 stars. Fresh and healthy, just like the sign says. I will leave the authenticity review up to those who know better.

ZAD0bP19qLWDddv2tS4wgA.text: If I could eat at Zeitouni every day of the week, it would not be often enough. Everything I've tried there has been simply outstanding.   It's not a fancy place. You walk up to the counter, place your order, and wait. You might wait a while for your food, in fact (because they have a small grill/kitchen/prep area and a line out the door of hungry customers). Finding a table is a bit of a chore, too. Just imagine you're in the middle of NYC awaiting the best Gyros (or other mediterranean treat), and you will feel better about standing around waiting on a table in the middle of a strip mall in Ballantyne. : )  I've tried practically everything on the menu, so I can't comment on everything. But.. the standouts to me are: Potato harra (on the side dish menu), Gyros (of course, get the platter, you won't be disappointed when you have leftovers to take home), the hummus and pita, the shawarma.. Geez, it's all so stinkin' good, you just have to go and experience it yourself to understand where I'm coming from, OK? And then write me and tell me you thought of it.   Be sure to take some baklava or other sweet treats to go, and buy extra because you'll want to share it with a good friend (if it lasts that long).  Delish!!!

vBeQT7VyLK08a04QpeUIZA.text: I liked it, but too over-rated.  If u get the entrees only then maybe it's affordable, but if u add on any sides, they charge a lot for a small portion. . . I guess that's how they make the money. . . $1 for extra white sauce. . . Bhaklava $1.80 for that little less than average tasting piece. . . please!

7OURn-dvPxh_aNEx0rNtrQ.text: I haven't tasted the food yet but being on hold for 10 minutes and walking in and seeing no one in line and the phone lying down isn't a good start.  Then giving me a side order rather appetizer order of grape leaves didn't help.  Well then rather than up charging the price difference I was charged for another side.  Food may be great but don't need heartburn before the meal.

wLKdKEeg-TEGTHnGWNtr8Q.text: After hearing all of the amazing reviews I finally tried this place. I wasn't surprised that it was good. It was awesome! I am a huge fan of Mediterranean and middle eastern food and Zeitouni has to be my favorite. We had the gyro and shawarma and both were fantastic!! The gyro was the best ever!!! The staff are very friendly as well and always have smiles on their faces! I love this place and I am so happy that it so close to my house :)

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shawerma!!

y3Ovjm47pzopkM2s1uG01Q.text: I stopped in after work, around 6pm on a Friday. I was worried after hearing about how busy it always is, but I was able to go right up to the counter and order. I decided on the falafel platter which included a choice of hummus or babba ghanouj and a choice of a salad with olives and feta, fatoush or tabbouleh. The hummus was perfect. It comes with 3 pita diamonds and when that runs out, the falafel is pretty tasty dipped in it. The tahini sauce on top of the falafal tasted really great and helped keep them moist. Overall, it was the best falafal I've found in Charlotte. They wear their Yelp best of sticker, well!!

LqcKus6kExNQvN2ZdsSKqQ.text: Tired of BBQ while in NC?  How about some kebabs, falafel, hummus, and stir fried potatoes?  The chicken kebabs are really tender and moist here.  Served over a bed of rice, a choice of salad, and another side for the platter.  Saw another table had the gyro with fries.  Looked really good.  Only regret is not ordering the Lebanese beer to go with the grub.

3NgpG-u-Cv1CaWBroH0XhA.text: Best chicken kabobs i had in a LONG time!  Wish they were open on sunday!!! I love this place!!!!

7LLl7jHrZLIWRJyaD6Q-9A.text: I live in LA where you can definitely find a lot of five stars authentic foods. Well, I'm here for the second week of my training for my new job, I arrived to Charlotte Monday afternoon and I'm going to stay till Friday noon. It's Wednesday and it's literally the third night that I'm having my dinner in Zeitouni Grill! Their food is just what I want, tender, authentic Mediterranean and delicious. Couldn't have had anything better than their chicken kabob or shawerma. I'm gonna eat the whole week in this place since I'm pretty sure that I won't find a similar I'm Los Angeles. Highly recommended ! Enjoy :)

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. My favorite Mediterranean !

-06TcXCN793xMBvqZyt-vg.text: The next stop on my Charlotte tour of Mediterranean food spots is...Zeitouni Grill!  I work at Toringdon. You know, that office/business complex, right off of 485 on the Johnston Road exit, where the Red Robin and Earth Fare are both located? You know, there? Got it? See it? That building directly across the street from Red Robin? That's where I work. See me waving? Hi!  So my point to Toringdon is this: other than Red Robin (which, frankly, is pretty meh when it comes to burgers, and the atmosphere sucks) or Earth Fare (which, frankly, their take-out/dine-in options leave plenty to be desired, especially from such a place that supposedly prides itself on health food alternatives that cater to the surplus number of crunchy granolas living in exile from Asheville, and the die-hard fitness freaks that show up all sweaty and red-faced and all jacked-up on adrenaline and self-importance after having done some hardcore yoga at the Urban Active across the street...but anyway...), a quick or at least convenient meal that doesn't require you to get in your car and navigate the fustercluck that is Johnston Road during lunch time, AND you're pretty tired of brown bagging it every day, then what the hell are you going to do for lunch, huh?  Thankfully, Zeitouni Grill proves a more-than-welcome respite from the ordinary. And Zeitouni Grill does not disappoint.  The platters are always a good option. Choose from a trio of Shishes (I just made that word up) - Kabob, Tawooq, or Kefta - or the Shwarma (the "Avengers" Special! - You know what I'm talking about!), and you get your choice of two sides - hummus or babba ghanouj (neither will disappoint) and either tabbouleh, fatoush, or the Mediterranean salad. Personally, I love their falafel. I haven't had decent falafel since I left NYC, and this is about as close as what I used to sample when I slummed it on Lexington Avenue near Kips Bay. Simple fare, yet colorful and plenty flavorful, just as I would expect from this kind of cuisine.  Keep in mind this place stays busy during weekday lunch hours, so be prepared to wait about 10-15 minutes for your plate. Worth the wait, though.  I'm here about once a week. But this place is so damned good, I might be coming here more than once a week. I think the shish tawooq is calling my name.

D5VLF4lOny8v0DqcLQ2YNQ.text: Very good, very fresh, very clean, very friendly.  But take note - this is just a lunch counter-type place. My first impression of Zeitouni is a good one, they have a good basis of food.  Now, they need to work on the atmosphere just a bit. I could eat there often; it looks like a great variety of more healthy and more indulgent items; it would be hard to get 'fatigue'. I wasn't hungry enough to sample a platter, so I only had the falafel appetizer. Their recipe is excellent, and the item was nicely presented with some pita, tomato and sauce.  My lunch mate offered a stuffed grape leaf to me as well.  The dolmas are warm here, which was not expected and the filling is creamy and soft (a little mushy for my liking). Everything was well-seasoned. I will definitely go back and try more at this no-frills eatery.

ViSQ6ZeUoBBVV_rC1KrqTg.text: I'm completely enamored with Zeitouni's simplicity. By far one of the best Med restaurants I've visited in quite some time and at a pricepoint that is hard to beat. We've passed by this joint on multiple occasions and, by the number of outstanding reviews, we couldn't wait any longer.   When I say simple, it's in the best way possible. Not glitz and glamour for Z's. A few simple murals on the wall depicting a map of northern Africa and most of the Mediterranean...and that's about it. It's all about the food here. Just how it should be.   The staff is very kind. Even courteous enough to ask if you've ever "experienced Mediterranean food before" and walk you through the different preparations and choices. Much of which can vary slightly, but always good for a refresher.   Onward to the meal! My wife got the Falafel platter. Perfect orbs of crispy outside and warm, soft, flavorful inside. Not dry and also not overly moist. Topped generously with a mix of veggies and fantastically mixed tabbouleh. Finally! A place that uses bulgar wheat! The pickled veg was incredible.   I ordered the mixed platter. All three skewers they have with a dashingly colorful salad and pita/hummus. The chicken by far has the most flavor. Charred bits from the grill and marinated in something that fell from the heavens. The lamb and beef skewers also retained a ton of flavor. All of the spice mixtures are pungent but not overpowering. Perfect balance from three equally delicious animals.   The place is clean, busy, simple and has flavors that will make you think you're chillin in Tel Aviv. Can't wait to go back and get the Shawarma platter!

exurBjjk_FP5zFokSU7-ZQ.text: Great Lebanese food was the last thing I expected to find in Charlotte but Zeitouni is definitely a gem. Their food is always fresh, and their chicken kabobs are grilled to perfection, lightly charred on the outside and moist in the middle. Their Gyros are the best I've ever had. They come fully loaded with pieces of shaved beef and lamb,  diced tomatoes and the greatest tasting tzatziki sauce to ever cover this middle eastern taco. Everything  seems to be made in house, hence the freshness. Therefore, depending on how busy they are; expect to wait anywhere from 10 to 20 min to get your food. It's worth the wait. The food quality and flavors here blow Zoe's kitchen out of the water any day.

_HXlXLmS6j9iUa2_D1VZoA.text: I can't bring myself to give Zeitouni 5 stars... I've lived in bigger cities and have simply had better Middle Eastern food.  With that said, I eat lunch here 1-2 times a week and I've been told I'm their most regular customer.  You just can't get better food for this price, not in Ballantyne.  Consider the fact that Chick-fil-A and other fast food costs about the same.  Not only that, but this place is pretty healthy which is another reason why I eat here so frequently.  Most of the food is grilled and made of quality meats and ingredients.    Favorite Lunch Items: 1.  Kefta Sandwich 2.  Chicken Gyro Sandwich 3,  Shish Kabab Sandwich  I typically go for hummus with meditterean meals but Zeitouni's is nothing special.  The hand-made french fries, however, are pretty awesome.  Recommendation:  Make a "real gyro", which I have yet to find in Charlotte.  I'm a huge fan when this is done right and the only way is to use a vertical rotisserie -which I understand is an issue considering Charlotte's stringent sanitary ratings.  I just hate it when places use frozen meat, which I'll admit you don't do with any other items.  This is what holds me back from rating Zeitouni 5 stars.  Honestly, as a business decision I don't know that I would considering how popular the restaurant already is and the previously mentioned sanitary issue.

WUCWExKidcopOLfa0VVGuA.text: By far one of my favorite Mediterranean places in the area. The food is fresh and flavorful. They have a great staff and do a great job.

vl3FJIR8sDN_JyF4KinMIQ.text: Really good food but service can be aggravatingly slow especially on weeknights when they have less staff.  I would probably go more often if service was more organized.

U9_xvglI0HwMQ0Hp_oFGKQ.text: I love Arabic food, but hard to find authentic place that isn't breaking about 20 health codes. This place is not only super tasty, but clean and great staff. I never write reviews, but I was so impressed with the quality of meat and how good the food was, I couldn't help myself!

sL6QY1t0r_5XzTsq3PTPdQ.text: My wife and I stopped here for lunch. We're both vegetarians and found the options somewhat limited, though typical of what you'd expect from a Mediterranean quick service restaurant.   We found their food to be incredibly salty - to the point where the potatoes were inedible.  The falafel wasn't terrible, but it was a bit greasy and very crumbly. An attempt to get it on a fork resulted in it breaking into smaller and smaller pieces until I eventually just scooped up the crumbs.  To top it all off, every table in the place was dirty, as was their display cases and the floor. (Though to be fair, it looks like they were in the middle of a rush from the Gymboree class next door, so perhaps it would have been better an hour earlier or later.)  Finally, when I got home, I noticed they over-charged my credit card by $3.   I was excited that there might be another good place for hummus and falafel in town, but I'll be sticking with Kabob Grill. We won't be going back here.

xwYGEeUqB0LBWEdhPiDvzw.text: This is my new jam!!  I know they aren't new but I am new to them.  I loved it!!  I ordered the falafel platter which may seem uneventful but for those of you that know falafel's can be a very delicate topic.  They are by no means a "one size fits all" type of deal.  But Zeitouni's hit the nail on the head!!!  So scrumptious!  The platter comes with a 2 sides...basically hummus and a small greek salad.  Everything was excellent.  The hummus was creamy and I don't know what all they use but it was just very good.  The falafel bites were fried to perfection, and the tahini dipping sauce was awesome.  The salad was weak in terms of size but it was still very good.  The pita bread that was served was also weak but I will let that slide.    Overall, booming place.  Everything looked good, smelled good and was good.  Not a lot going on in this shopping center but you can stop in at earth fare before or after if needed!  You could also sit outside at Zeitouni's which is always fun.  They served wine..didn't see beer but I assume beer as well.    I will definitely be back.

M6wdG84X4tIRHGNH9jaWRg.text: Delicious food and great service!! Highly recommend! Best Mediterranean cuisine in the US :))

xYYHzL3qOztpHY8MixNMFg.text: This is definitely the best middle eastern place in Charlotte. It is very fast, the service is excellent, they make great use of seating in this restaurant and best of all, TRULY AUTHENTIC. My falafel wrap was served warm in a foil, inside it is filled with hearty falafel, veggies and amazing tahini sauce. The stuffed grape leaves I ordered were just perfect, not too sour, just the right amount of oil and very great stuffing that makes me want to call this place a home. Overall this place is great because: 1. Committed family business 2. passion for great authentic middle eastern food 3. very quick service 4. friendly and knows how to do business right! 5. Fair prices for amazing food!  This place resembles everything that embodies a restaurant with a sound business model, bravo!

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Falafel wrap with stuffed grape leaves!

UAv4g5IA_nepk9EJPqsH2Q.text: Great spot for lunch or dinner. If you eat meat or if you have a plant based diet, this place is a must try!!  I can't find something on the menu that I don't like.  Falafels are spot on and who new I liked babba ghanoush & tabbouleh so much.  This place may have the ability to convert you into a Lebanese food junkie

uXJfT1YVKrfDYO8Ck5GOwQ.text: I think this place hews closer to 3.5 stars. Not the best Lebanese/Mediterranean but still good. Would be a solid four except that we had to stand and wait for a table to be cleaned after we ordered (had to ask twice) and when our food arrived, I requested hot sauce, waited a few minutes before realizing they forgot and going up to the counter to re-request it.  Other than that, however, not bad. Place is a tad cramped but I'm all about the food and that's where Zeitouni draws its highest marks. We had the lamb kebab with baba ghanouj, and a lamb shawarma pita sandwich. All tasty although I wish the pita bread was warm and/or toasty (personal preference though). Glad I tried the joint out. Not exactly memorable but certainly good enough to satisfy my Mediterranean itch when needed.

JMcnQSYphX4DvvRoMw6vlw.text: It was ok, falafels didn't taste fresh. It could be because we reached 20 mins before closing.

zxhY6p-fvFXj3HXbF5Jyug.text: Wonderful, fresh, fast and flavorful. Helpings of the platter are single size. Good for lunch and dinner but not for leftovers. I love lemon and the tabbouleh was PERFECT! Shawarma is perfectly seasoned. Hummus a bit plain. UT very good and good consistency. Got an order to go to try dessert and grape leaves. Definitely would go back and I wish they catered :)

uWfuuL4bBVrflO9Bj2Z_7A.text: Great food and very fresh! Hummus is always good as well. Salad seemed fresh. Counter staff was helpful in guiding us in what to try.

sUarkdlaH93zsEQR9dQtsA.text: Fast simple delicious Mediterranean food. Loved the falafel wrap. Highly recommend for a quick meal.

v72I7O1Al5YBVi-0MAHpsQ.text: I got the falafel app plater and it was delicious! Crunchy on the outside and soft and moist on the inside! I will come back soon to try other dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

Efw_KrXqqdS-ieCjlKgc4A.text: What a great lunch or quick dinner place! We stopped in here for lunch the other day and left happily with a full belly! I had the chicken kebob plate with taboule and hummus. The chicken was very moist and went so well with the taboule and hummus! My husband had the mixed combo plate ( steak and ground beef) with babagaoush and salad. He loves Mediterranean food and is very picky about his meat but he keeps talking about how good his dish was!  We will definitely be back =)

F-a_Az7sbT0H_oGZGgalzg.text: A great, casual spot for quality Lebanese food with friendly service. The hummus bi tahina was smooth and nutty. The grape leaves were more Greek style,  but still very good. The falafel had a nice complex flavor, with a touch of cinnamon. Shawarma was fresh and savory. I never had potato harra before, but was pleasantly surprised by the tart and garlicky flavor. The fatoush had a nice sumac dressing, that was on the salty side, but I prefer my fatoush that way. Would have liked more vegetables in the fatoush, but it was a side salad with the mezza platter, so it may not be the norm if you order the dinner size salad. Compares very well to the Lebanese restaurants I frequent in northern NJ. I highly recommend.

d_atxRfVIyEwJ6F1V5c4bg.text: Food was good and tasted fresh. The workers weren't every talkative and the transaction was difficult to get through.. if you've never been there before and have questions they don't really explain much to you about their menu. They were nice when we were about to leave.  Only a few tables have more than 2 seats. 4 stars are for the food and not service.

WVTvPAZKnNtKzs0kmgnuDg.text: Has made me a die-hard fan of Lebanese cuisine. Easily the best hummus I've had - and I've had a lot of hummus. Would recommend Zeitouni's to anyone. Definitely give the shish tawooq (chicken skewer) sandwich a try, and ask about the shish tawooq special (which is not on the menu) as well, and you won't regret it.

HnTGTvnlpCPOwu_Echiy9g.text: I love this place! They have some of the best food that I've had in The Mediterranean/Middle Eastern type food. I actually wish there were more like this around that would be closer to where I live. The food is so good that it's worth the 10 mile drive. I've had Baba ghanouj in San Francisco, several times in Washington DC, and a few times here in Charlotte. They make some of the best that I've tasted in all of my travels.

vt3ND9zKHlGbZr9iPXPI2Q.text: This place is delicious! Definitely one of my favorites. Everything is so good. While I typically do take out, I have dined in. It's very casual, great, friendly staff & we even enjoyed a lovely bottle of Lebanese wine with our food. Highly recommend it!

lDBXxPXAJlTiQTPSQIXphg.text: 5 stars becoz it is the best falafel I have had in the U.S.... It is sooo authentic... Not the Americanized versions of NYC..... The bakhlava was so fresh and awesome.... I simple loved the place..... The kebab platters were also really good!

zZ3N3SB6k8k-D6YX2HY57w.text: It's really tasty.... And I'm glad this place is here. Hummus is great and marinated chicken is fantastic. The only downside is Friday nights - we've been a few times and they've run out of hummus!!! A mediterranean place without hummus is disappointing - but the babbaghanoush is solid and the falafels are also very good. Grape leaves are a little soggy compared to what we loved in little Greece in NYC, but trust me, this place has won our hearts and we hope they stay for a very long time. Excellent baklava for dessert too!!!

-b4Ql20_vnvNvuqXQZImwQ.text: Zeitouni Grill, meh- it was my second time at this restaurant. Not bothering to ever go back. Number 1- It was empty at dinner time..that should have told me something..Number 2 -The food is just not up to Par,,,,Just not great or memorable. We sampled a lot of the menu again. The tablouli is all parsley, no Bulgar wheat at all, it was actually the best dish of all the things we tried. The Falafel was over fried and tasted like it was stale. The Gyro was so skimpy on the amount of meat, I was very surprised, it was all lettuce and tzatziki sauce. We had the Potatoes Harra, which was fried potatoes with Lemon, garlic and olive oil, they would probably have been good if they were warm..it was just room temperature and they also tasted old. The Baba Gohnuji was creamy and had a nice smoky flavor. The thing I cant understand is that if there was no one in their why wouldnt the food have been freshly made..it was like some Lebanese Aunt came the week before and they were heating up all the food she made. Just not very good at all....Sorry....

Nu6grQKh_CdKD3oNPLI5uQ.text: I had the SHISH TAWOOQ platter with 1 kefta skewer and 1chicken skewer, salad and hummas.  Truly the best hummas I have ever had.  The food was so fresh, the skewers were tender and had amazing flavor.  We will be back.

FO-jGHUj7RzQmjE1W5rqCg.text: Love this place, great Lebanese food, friendly staff too, reasonable prices.  The best falafel I have had in years!!

rcXB89oMPSA0Gs3zYncU4A.text: Great place with friendly "guidance" from the staff. I highly recommend the mixed platter as a first option to get a broad taste of what Zeitouni has to offer. A piece of baklava to finish and you will go home very full and completely satisfied!

EwUFjmpIM87i_EI0DeiJMg.text: Had a wonderful meal with friends -- enjoyed every entree! The chicken and beef kebabs were cooked to perfection. Began with hommous and babaghanoush appetizers all the way to coffee and pakhlava, and loved every morsel! Will come back for more....

Oc1smojRAl3-3lX8nGj2GA.text: In the Charlotte area and hit Yelp for a recommendation.    This was a great choice and I enjoyed my meal.  I selected grapes leaves and the falafel platter.  Great choice  It's a family run business. And three of the family made and served my meal.   I highly recommend this location.

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

tKYyc9w5EObFG6zYWf7Rdw.text: Kids review: Faaaaaalaaaafel! Also loved the tangy potatoes (hats) and the chicken kebab (shishtaouk). Desserts are yummy. Try the cashew lady fingers.   Parents review: fresh and so good! Spicy beef shawarma with tabouleh and hummus is where it's at. Also the grape leaves (dolmades) are delicious. The food is amazing, quick for take our, service super friendly. Highly recommend!

NqTbCRgELoEFjAjpowtxkw.text: Nice and cosy place. The place is clean and it feels very cool inside. As i visited fist time I was exited to taste there specials chiken kabob and shworma. The only thing I felt here was the pictures which they have uploaded here seems larger for the food they serve. But I felt it was keep it short but sweet. I loved the Baklava off course. Those who have sweet tooth or even those who don't, every one should definitely taste this sweet little thing.  Chicken kabob was so delicious. Shworma and baklava too. I ordered grape leaves too on the side; but I got little disappointed with this. This looked very cute and tasty was the stuffing. But when took overall bite it was very, very I mean very sour and vinegary. ( be careful while you order this its very sour) . I liked baklava so much that i would be wanting to come again just to have it.:)

Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Heavenly sweet baklava.

yINswQJs8v0DX050l79ojw.text: Friendly staff, but uncomfortable (and limited) indoor seating. The menu isn't large, but what they do make was mostly good. The chicken kabob was well seasoned and the beef kabob was just alright--chewy, even.   If you're looking for a quick to-go meal with Lebanese flair, then you could do worse, but there's room for improvement here.

7lfVap97W2X9olzmV14Auw.text: Great food always. Today it was the chicken gyro.  The humus is great and comes with a side as a combo.  Be patient as they cook it when you order and it takes a bit.  It's not a fast food restaurant.  Love family owned businesses.

pCotZz-rjn51Yxowd8kl1g.text: One of my favorite Mediterranean, a good selection of Baklava and other sweets. The service is excellent.

3QbnUBGFi3xC3LTju0XM-w.text: Really good. Surprisingly good. I ordered the mezza platter which is served with potato harra (diced potatoes), grape leaves and falafel. The falafel was the best I've had in Charlotte--not overly fried, tahini drizzled on top. You get a choice of salad--the fattoush was excellent. You also get a dip. I always go for Baba ghanouj and the flavor was good but I like it creamier. It was a small portion of the baba ghanouj but a lot of food overall. It was $11 and a delicious meal. A little pricey but I'll come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mezza platter

33iitFapPH30F4Js0taYWg.text: We saw Zeitouni at the last second and decided to try it.  It was a great decision.  Had the grape leaves and the Gyro platter.  The food was really good and I will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

a4EegxXaKd8bG9B3NGFpCQ.text: If you like Lebanese, then this is the spot. Normally when I'm going out to eat I like to sit down and look over a menu, especially in places like this where the menu may look a little different. However, that does not stop me from coming here. The food is absolutely delicious and spiced to perfection. I've never been to Lebanon let alone to anywhere in the middle east, but this place will instantly take your taste buds there.   Let's talk customer service. My friend ordered the wrong plate (kind of a newbie) and so when she went to order what she actually wanted they did not charge her. Hey, a girl can confuse gyro with chicken. Right?

ieqIHdDh6EEp9zj4CmmmIg.text: Fantastic Mediterranean restaurant- food is great and service is fast and very friendly

zREqzb7QZFHdBasJK_E76g.text: Excellent food. Friendly (but busy) staff. Fairly typical quick-serve atmosphere. But well worth a visit.   As vegan eaters, we are always looking for good vegan-friendly restaurants. Living in the south Charlotte suburbs has proven a challenge for us. But Zeitouni Grille is a welcome addition to our list.   Their Falafel is totally vegan (as it should be), made in the Lebanese tradition with pickles and a bit of spice. Really nicely done. Tasty, inexpensive and fast. There are other vegan-friendly menu items, as well, although we've been a bit obsessed with the falafel.   AUTHENTIC Lebanese cuisine! I highly recommend this place!

u23m-1HoYCEpPFq7pdSLzA.text: First try, so a little disappointed but worth trying a few different items next time.   Pros- Hummus wash very creamy and good with good pita bread, wife loved the grape leaves.  Cons, Babaganouj was very garlicky, Gyro was not freshly sliced beef, just a couple of slabs of meat and some very heavy tzatziki, so one bog heavy soggy mess that was inedible.

Dqfmz6Px2po5S6NPvMsPzQ.text: A good lunch crowd is a good sign.   The line moved quickly and we found a table by the time we ordered.  Be warned there is little seating and it will be tough for groups larger than 4 to be seated during busy times.  Food was ready quickly, only a few minutes after ordering.  My falafel sandwich was good though I would have liked a few more falafel in the sandwich.  There were as much pickles and tomatoes as there was falafel which seemed unbalanced.  My wife had the chicken gyro which was also good though light on the chicken.  The hummus side was tasty but very little pita was served with it and what we did get was cold.  If the pita were warm and a few more pieces all other issues would have been forgiven as the hummus was delicious!  If the were thing we could say about the place was that we wanted more of the food, that is a good sign.  We be coming back regularly.

ApzAkPa0-N-1O9WwCv8Tig.text: Really yummy lunch!  First time visit and both my husband and I were very pleased with our food. Got the potato harra appetizer on advice of other reviewers - yum!  My other favorites from the meal: the babba ghanouj dip, pitas, and baklava. Hubby loved his Shish Tawooq!

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

BFD5MOzZYzDxVD1NlJ7g8A.text: Great Mediterranean Food!  Quantity can be better, but the freshness and the taste of the food is great.  The platter gives you a great option for trying several items:  falafel, hummus, grape leaves (which are my favorite).  My husband loved the chicken shawarma as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

XxLJOkLjc7ysOLnR7yK3Vw.text: Quaint atmosphere with Lebanese  music playing softly only interrupted by the subtle sounds of the chef cooking and tapping along to the music. The staff is very friendly, you can't  help but to move to music. The gyro  is tremendously  satisfying; seasoned perfectly the portion is generous. The perfect lunch.

tnssEvyFL-VSACmKmFasdQ.text: Very happy about this place, the cuisine is highly accommodating for vegetarians and vegans. Everything tastes fresh and flavorful. We love the falafel sandwich, the pickled vegetables make it all the more delightful. We also love the sides and appetizers like potato harra and babba ganouj, we plan on trying everything we can. My only criticism is that it doesn't feel the most welcoming, staff will greet you but aren't involved with much else beyond the counter. Attitude during customer interaction seems to want to end the interaction as quick as possible. The food makes up for it, as it's delicious and you can take it to-go.

btaQ8x4bHWkJS-c3Gphe-w.text: If I could rate this place 3.5 stars I would, but I'm rounding up to 4 because I think the baklava is the best tasting thing in the restaurant. Must get! Even though it's $1.50 for a little square piece, it's definitely very worth it.   I ordered the shish kabob platter with the Mediterranean salad and Babba ghanouj. The meat was a bit over cooked and very chewy. The salad was good but tasted very acidic. The babba ghanouj, which is an eggplant dip was just ok. Overall, I wasn't that impressed with this platter.  I did like that the menu gave descriptions of the items of their menu. It helped me a lot when deciding what to order. I don't think I'll be back here but if I come back, it'll be for the baklava!

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Baklava

IQVGr2djZWdY1JmCKHA1jg.text: I frequently come to Charlotte for work and this has become one of my regular lunch spots. The falafel wrap is just dynamite and they have many other vegan options. My husband loved the chicken shawarma and the hummus was so much better than the store bought stuff. It's usually crowded and that speaks volumes about the quality and service here! Get here early for lunch to grab a table outside.

9K5ZpqoO5LAPaSfVUMRGkg.text: The food was excellent and inexpensive. The inside is very no frills. The service was top notch. We are in. The cashier who also brought our food was very thoughtful and anticipated our needs. Our food was made fresh to order and delivered piping hot. We didn't have to wait long. My only complaint would be that it was an unusually cold night in Charlotte and the inside of the restaurant wasn't as warm as I would prefer.

_kBHctsPtLc6LkZvjA2BQA.text: Every thing here is like fresh food and smells like authentic Mediterranean food.i have tried shawarma,falafel and Chicken sandwich rap, all are Yummy. Price also reasonable. The last is Baklava sweet. Don't forget too.

bWLiNYFse3KndI6yLY2uHg.text: Quick and tastes! I love that you can call in for pick up! I can't pronounce most of what is on the menu because it is authentic Greek so a few times I have ended up with something different but each time I have loved what I got!! Great price for a great lunch!!

Zd90BWUnoVW5qlDCoLED0A.text: OK, I'm at work, and should be productive, doing newsy thing, but I just got back from dinner break here, and MUST take 5 minutes write a review, I'm so thrilled.    Zeitourni Grill opened in July, but it's tucked away in the Earth Fare shopping center in Ballantyne, next to the Dippin' Dots, so it's easily overlooked.  (This was the former location for Quizno's).   When I walked in, a super cute woman was at the counter, and helped me make some suggestions on what to try.  I went with the kofta skewer and chicken platter, which I chose to have with babaganoush, and Mediterranean salad. Added a side of falafel. My dining partner had the kibbie.   Can I just say, my Middle Eastern (this cuisine is Lebanese to be exact) experiences in Charlotte have now reached a fever pitch with Kabob Grill being pretty good...then La Shish Kabob being excellent, and now ZG, my all-time fave in the city.    The chicken is so tender, so well seasoned...the kofta isn't dried out like most places and crusty, it's springy and moist.  The kibbie, I'm told is new and improved with more spice and is worth trying if you've never had it before.  Falafel side...two nice pieces, crispy fried, and drizzled with tahini and comes with pickled vegetables.   Platters come with dessert too, so we had two small baklava-esque pastry...extra crisp and flaky, fresh and sprinkles with pistachios.  The perfect two-bite size to end a meal.   The atmosphere is not shady like La Shish (of course it's not, it's in a spankin' new looking Ballantyne shopping center) and the inside is immaculate.  The owner was super sweet, seemed like an older man you want to sit down with and learn his life story.    Overall, it's a great casual eatery (order at the counter, wait for food type of joint) where the prices are pretty good.  (Our platters were $9.99 each, including the dessert.) I'll go back for sure when the craving hits!

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pardon the photo quality...the utterly delish kofta and chicken platter.

adlIO5xpockMSDtvoLUIMQ.text: My favorite Mediterranean food in Charlotte, hands down. Everything I've tried has been delicious!

FiIJU2Oq4uN_va_F1hIp3Q.text: So good! I ordered the Shawarma platter with Tabbouleh and Babba Ghanouj (eggplant dip). I'm hungry thinking about their food now...

-OxbdM21t3ta3rJGKA5TOA.text: Went a couple weeks ago and forgot to review. Went with my aunt, she has raved about it. I got the Falafel sandwich, was very good! Next time I would ask to add hummus on it. I got stuffed grape leaves for my side, not a fan at all. My aunt got the chicken platter with rice and taboouleh. Chicken was amazing. I was also not a fan of the taboouleh, but then again I never have been. We also got an app of hummus. Hummus was excellent. Wish I would have taken some home, it was seriously good. I love hummus and I'm very picky about it. All in all it was small portions for the price and I wasn't that impressed that I would be back.

ozyXSJzs1CSDrs0f0G1cxw.text: Good food. The portions could be bigger, but well prepared. The flavour reminds me home.

LNRSnk0JPdOhmT8GDMceXA.text: Disappointing. I ordered the Beef shawarma and was shocked at how small the wrap was. Barely had meat in it, pita was paper thin as if they opened the layer and wrapped it in half of it.  Tasted ok, that's it. I ordered the potatoes, which came in a nice size portion, I must admit. They were flavorful with garlic, cilantro, and tangy. Possibly had a shot of vinegar in them or lemon. Couldn't place the acid. Friend had the falafel, she said it was good. The grape leaves, we both agreed were small, but they were good, tho. I MIGHT try again, but it seems the prices were high for what I got. I wanted more sandwich, less potatoes. Not a fan.

o8SffXDivFX0ElzyhdpIVw.text: My favorite Mediterranean place in the Charlotte area. I've eaten here many times and I've never been disappointed.

nmURZ9iS3pVpSqB3QYUIsQ.text: I've not had a bad meal here!!! The fattoush salad is so good! The falafels are good. The shawarma, lamb, tabouli and hummus are good. They also do a lentil soup when it cold. This place is everything a restaurant should be!

dS-7BRj5K5NSxZHtgf2dyg.text: Oh, hello there some-of-the-best-food-I've-ever-had. I've not had very much experience with Mediterranean food, but I'm pretty sure this is as good as it gets.   My boyfriend found the place (major props to him!) and we both had the Shish Tawooq; a platter with rice, two skewers of chicken and your choice of two sides. I had hummus and tabbouleh. It was $10, took maybe 10 minutes, and it was amazing.   I can't wait to go back and try something new!

1J0uBGz7STN5QyErgx_4cg.text: It was okey a little pricey as all arabic food is. I always wonder why we don't get the appetizers fast like taboliy and baba ghanog these things supposed to be cooked already but you always have to wait a while after all is good but not the best.

Upc-lJsEeuRnp_ZAKX9vhQ.text: Today, was the first day I have ever been refused service! I took my 18 month old daughter to one of our favorite places to have lunch.  We have been here countless times and have always ordered the same thing - chicken kids meal minus the fries and drink but with a side of tabbouleh. Today I was told no we can't do that! I explained we always order the same thing every time was told, No! The manager looked right at me and said NO, then hung his head down and wouldn't look at me.   He didn't offer any solution! He could of said well I am sorry but we can do that but we can... Or we can but its going to cost a little more, just a flat at No we can't to that! I waited for a solution, but he was unresponsive.   Total lack of customer service and no healthy options for children! Only fries as a side for kids - I am sure in Lebanon they don't just give fries to kids.  Restaurants should offer healthy options or substitutions for kids not just unhealthy fries. To be blunt parsley, tomato, onions, mint &  bulgar is not pricey!   My 18 month old loves tabbouleh, kibbeh, falafel, & hummus.  After we were refused service we went over to the Kabob Grill in Ballantyne and they gladly served my 18 month old chicken and tabbouleh,  (subbing the fries) no questions asked. The server even commented how well she ate.   Needless to say we will not be returning to the restaurant due to the extremely RUDE service and lack of management skills.  I recommend you check out the Kabob Grill in Ballantyne or Dilworth. There is also a wonderful Arabic restaurant in Matthews Kabab the owner is from Beirut and is very customer service orientated.

cUf_xNc1PnwyVrk0BgWiHQ.text: My fiance and I wanted to try something new so we decided to come here. It was definitely different, but the food was amazing. Babba Ghanouj is my new favorite dip. I got the Shawarma and the beef was fantastic with the tahini sauce. My fiance got he Shish Tawooq and the chicken was grilled to perfection. The service was excellent and the food was brought to us quickly. I highly recommend Zeitouni if you're looking to try different foods.

4c59c1g7FVexceVCL4BxZg.text: Excellent food, absolute best hummus I have ever had.  Very friendly service.  If you are looking for quality food, served in about 10 minutes this is an excellent choice.  Order and pickup at the counter, seating available inside as well. I feel the price is slightly high for quantity of food compared to similar places, but quality is high.

jvnVu8w58rmnG1Eh88SLbA.text: Tasty authentic Lebanese food. I like the hummus very much. The marinated chicken is juicy and delicious. The best thing for me is their desert, the pistachio square one is the best, I went back for a second one!

WMPuWUHHtdtisOYg3jdSQg.text: Love this place.  Try the marinated grilled chicken.  The shish tawook sandwich is my favorite. Chicken gyro is great too.  They do get busy at lunch time but do well to manage the rush. I recommend calling ahead to avoid waiting, the guy who usually answers the phone and runs the register does a great job.  I waited a long time to write this review and give out my secrets about how amazing this place is, hope you enjoy it too.

8CpCj7zCJ12CMg-Jlpwj-w.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE! I come here at least twice a week, their food is excellent. Service is friendly and fast. It has become an instant favorite with the family... even the boys (5 & 8).

ATUFhHETaorJwwooauBt5A.text: Nestled in a strip mall you might overlook this place.  I had the chance to stop in yesterday to try it out and I wasn't dissapointed (completely).  Upon walking in I got the sense this place is popular based on the number of people in line and waiting for food.  That was probably the biggest drawback, the wait.  But the chicken I added to my greek salad needed time to cook I suppose so that was ok.  They did mess up my buddy's order so that wasn't exactly a good thing though.  My salad was great, fresh and cheaply priced in my opinion.  If you're coming in here for the atmosphere or the interior feel, you may, no you will be dissapointed.  I took my order to go.

UOOcNTKIhV_viTeHxxFHFg.text: Dined in today. Had the mezza platter with beans instead of potatoes, hummus, and fattoush. I love their potatoes, but I try (a little half-assedly) to cut carbs and their beans are heavenly....I mean I've daydreamed about the beans since my last visit. The falafel was hot and fresh. The fattoush is some of the best I've had and the dressing is just right. The pita could have been fresher.  After I finished, I ordered the kibbie special to go for my husband. The guy asked me if I'd had it before, and I told him I had and didn't like it. Now I know that I didn't like the kibbie I had before. THIS kibbie, I like.

T-l-wET33D9iXN_DxljfVg.text: I don't wanna bury the lede, so lemme just start with FALAFEL. Now that that's over...  I was running errands the day before Thanksgiving and needed some grub. Zeitouni's been on my target list for awhile, and I got there around 12:30. I waited at the counter for a good 5 minutes before anyone acknowledged me; to be fair, the four guys behind the counter cooking were slammed, but it was a little annoying. That's where the annoyance ended.  I ordered the shish kabob platter, and the man who took my order asked if it was my first time. When I said it was, he said I had to go with the shish tawooq. I'm never one to question the best a restaurant has to offer, so I went with it! It came with a salad and a dip, so I went with hummus for the dip and asked to substitute falafel for the salad. Best decision I made all day (all month?).  I grabbed one of the few remaining tables, and they brought out my plate just a few minutes later. The man wasn't lying about how good the shish tawooq was - the chicken was grilled to perfection, moist (I know, I hate that word, too), and deeeeeliciously seasoned. However, the falafel was SO good that I debated most of the time I ate about whether I should eat them both first, eat one first and then save the last one, or try to save them both for last. I went with the bookend strategy. The hummus was perhaps the best I've ever had, but the pita was thinner and chewier than I'm used to. Not my jam but y'all might like it that way.  All that and a water cost me about $11.50, and it was worth every penny.

h9Razvpl8RQZXiQRWFxNZw.text: My favorite casual Mediterranean food in town. I've been coming here for almost three years. Every single dish in this restaurant is delicious!! The food is aromatic. The falafel is moist and very tasty. The potato harra explodes with the flavors of different spices. The hummus is smooth and addictive, and all the vegetables taste fresh. The grape leaves are also good. The gyro is my favorite and for. Forget to get some baklava for dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gyros platter with hummus and tabbouleh
Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grape leaves
Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gyros sandwich

ef7x3OHsWFHhCTGGuIPwBA.text: So this is one of my all time quick service places to go to. I adore their food and I always leave feeling full and happy, yet not disgusting as if I gorged myself.  You can't go wrong with their hummus. Very fresh and made in house. I cannot seem to get enough of their falafel. They're crispy and not greasy and have a great flavor. I always have to order one of their salads. The tabouli is just so good and refreshing. We always order a fatoush salad and add grilled chicken to it to share.  The sandwiches and platters are all amazing and you honestly cannot go wrong. My husband always orders kefta either in a sandwich or on one of the platters. All of the meats are deliciously marinated, juicy, and cooked in front of you on the grill. The only drawback for me is that they are closed on Sunday. Order yourself a coffee and a piece of baklava to round out your meal and all will be well!

fwno1IsVnXFscU3jpMCTng.text: I love Mediterranean food. I grew up on Greek food and am very versed. This place is Lebanese which is similiar to Greek with middle eastern influences in the form of prep and spices.  I've been here before but wasn't such a foodie back then.  We came here for lunch takeout and work. I ordered the shwarma platter which came with beef pieces slice stewed in tahini sauce with onion and tomato with pieces of pita bread with babba ghanouj( eggplant dip) and tabbouleh(minced parsley salad).  It was incredible. Such simple ingredients combined in a complex manner with amazing flavor. It really felt like True Mediterranean. It was hot and ready in 20 minutes. Prices were very reasonable for quality and quanity.  I was impressed.   I got the dolma( stuffed grape leaves) as s side and they were authentic and stuffed and rolled jusy right.  My buddy got the gyro platter with the humus and Mediterranean. And my other buddy got the shwarma platter with the same with a side of falafel and they both love it.  Will definitely be back for more.

VOpHIR6S6xWhKTQXldU8Mw.text: Had a late lunch and Ordered a falafel to-go. Then decided to stay because the music, people, and service was amazing. Try Zeitouni Grill for sure.

K1ss6dTXJjvBsv3Y8sSvJA.text: Highly recommend over the chain fare Greek food available. Freshly made and friendly atmosphere. Some patio seating available as well. You can mix and match sides. The Greek salad is good and I had a chicken gyro with Taziki sauce. They are closed on Sunday and don't be fooled if it looks busy. They have seating towards the back of the restaurant and take out is available.

yPQKKvwHSaLFkCIhOb_RpQ.text: Hmmmmm, something has changed....been going here for a couple years but lately my  order is ALWAYS wrong & the customer service is not friendly/inviting. It's like order, pay, get out, NEXT! I will not return.

JI10FAQokiE4R0sJf8JlXA.text: This is probably my favorite Mediterranean/Greek/Lebanese restaurant in Charlotte!  The service and the food is fantastic. The best Mediterranean salad in Charlotte hands-down!! If I don't have time to sit and eat in the cozy, simple grill, I will get my order to go. They are very quick and always friendly. On a nice day, it's great to eat outside on their outside tables.

FS8UvQhKjJmEcG6QIkBz8w.text: Good good place, with excellent food. Fresh, fulfilling, not overwhelming, very urban, welcoming and light.  I enjoyed the place and would honestly consider it the best quick-stop place for good quality Mediterranean food.

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jyro platter and chicken kabob

OPaaRL6tNAdN50I2Uuj9bQ.text: Awesome Lebanese food! Also a very sweet staff. Gave us free dessert so we could try his favorite. Will be coming back

QnCwHcoO5t5lVGTQP1N7og.text: Amazing food with amazing service!!! My go to place for a quick lunch or dinner. Family owned and operated, which makes a difference!! If you have not tried Zeitouni grill yet, check it out!!! You WILL NOT be disappointed. Very authentic and always delicious.

HX4FzA1bO89MVTes-XhPxw.text: Our second visit, like the first, did not disappoint. We shared the mixed skewers and the mezza plate. Food, service and cleanliness were acceptable. Light, open dining area occupied with a delightfully diverse crowd.  Highlights include the chicken kabobs and falafel. Taboleh salad also fresh and delicious. Quantities and bread were somewhat lacking.  Everything was tasty but we have been spoiled by the plethora of other Lebanese/middle eastern restaurants in Charlotte, namely Kabob Je Rotisserie.  It also attracts a diverse following but has also much better bread baked continually in a centrally located stone oven (and included in the price of an entree), much more appealing plating, presentation and atmosphere, and is a much better overall value.  Still, if you are in a bind for time and have yen for kabobs, this place is definitely work a try.

zGa7_mAS62aY9EAFiskbpQ.text: This is a great spot for a quick vegan lunch. The food is very authentic and naturally vegan and the staff is more than happy to help you figure out what is vegan / what needs to be altered to be made vegan.   Love this place! Closed Sunday's.

S1L1o1KsTqAUl-mI0yyv4Q.text: Good place to have Mediterranean food ... I loved the platter and falafel . Everything tastes delicious and authentic ..  Ambience is normal , they have a lot of sitting space outside and inside . We chose to sit out because of lovely weather . You need to place order at the counter and they serve you at table . I liked the way they served on bamboo trays with long handle to people sitting outside .   Not that expensive will cost around $25 - $30 for two for the kind of portion me and my husband eat .

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummy veg Greek food
Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

4rHa2Yje726pqwhkvnPgsA.text: I've been here several times and I love it! The first time I went I had the shiq tarook which is a wrap with chunks of chicken pickles and garlic sauce.  I usually get the fattoush but I keep thinking back to that shiq tarook and today I got it and it was soooo tasty..I had it spicy.  Chunks of chicken that are tender thick and oozing flavor with crunchy pickles and a toasty wrap. The garlic sauce was not white it was orange-pink I guess since I had it spicy.  I scraped every last bit from the tray.  I had the hummus as a side and it was so fresh.  Very fast casual arm friendly people.  Nice filling meal that didn't break the bank at $9...
