iyME1Dpj8D2tixjBo3updg.text: Tabouleh, Chicken Gyro, Hummus with pita points.  The Tabouleh was perfect in every authentic way & fresh. The Chicken Gyro tasted delicious and served on a fresh soft pita-however was drenched in tziki  sauce and I like a lot but every time I bit into my sandwich the sauce which was more runny than I prefer gushed out. The Hummus was perfect in every authentic way & very fresh but the pita points in which I dipped in the hummus were like leather  Everything tasted great but I couldn't give them 5 stars because of the leather-like pita points & the overly sauced Gyro sandwich

1kfErS2PbmBPPw4BWbvYKA.text: What a disappointment. I'm not sure why it took 30 minutes to make a Gyro and Humus, but it did. Most Greek restaurants will put the Tzatziki sauce on the side if you order it to go. When I got home the sauce had turned to buttermilk. It literally tasted as if it was spoiled. The Humus was fair (I have had way in better other places) and the pita bread was skimpy at best.  The thing I noticed the most was the lack of customer service. It was like the staff didn't really want to be there. Other customers were complaining about the wait and the only response they got was "It will be right up". I saw one couple just get up and leave. All in all there are much better places to enjoy Greek and Mediterranean food in the Charlotte area, so I would give this one a pass.

JTsDRmE1G64g432msVD0oA.text: So good!!! Full of flavor. Best hummus I've ever had and the baklava is incredible. Must try!

_KZdYzuDzIwd8BuKNkixWg.text: Absolutely delicious! Reminds me of being home -- So fresh and extremely authentic!! Definitely will be making trips here often

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

XTXKMr30QHGZ7rRoL4rcGA.text: Zeitouni Grill has a delicous selection of Lebanese dishes!  I love the Lebnah, kababs and the houmus.  Wassim always makes the experience even better ;)

Ne6FI9GOT14ghB0kICOF3A.text: Good place - authentic food - but needs a sparkle to it - kofta was not seasoned enough, rice was ok, falafel was very fresh but not enough seasoning. Overall good place the cook needs to taste his/her food and it will be perfect

ChiRdrkSjTqnPrXacX71-A.text: "Not the best I've had, but definitely good enough to fill a craving, and I'm pretty picky about Middle Eastern since I grew up there. The hummus and tabouleh were good and I was excited they had Zataar bread, as it's hard to find."

kvNybdglkG5wBeuMewPO0Q.text: My husband and I come here to eat every couple weeks (if not more), usually after a workout.  The food is delicious and no matter what you order, you are not left with the heavy feeling you get at other restaurants.  We usually get a combo, mine with a salad and his with a sandwich and it comes out to $21.  It's a bit pricey, but totally worth it for the taste.  The baba ganoush has a deep smokey flavor, almost like they have added liquid smoke, and we love it.  I always opt for the grape leaves and they are perfect every time.  Coming from a restaurant family, I do notice is seems as though the drink machine could always use a better wipe-down, or at least more frequently, but that is a minor complaint.   We would highly recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for something different and we will keep going as long as their doors stay open and they don't increase their prices!

uOmLqJt160hMIUL_IIvmqA.text: Such an amazing find! I'd eat here everyday if I lived closer. Best falafel I've ever had and the hummus was excellent.

ZAz_brKQTw3ke-zObtn7pg.text: A Lebanese friend recommended Zeitouni and he was right. Fresh and affordable and authentic Lebanese food. The falafel, kefta, hummus, and fatoush are all excellent! Wassim's staff is some of the friendliest in Charlotte! Highly recommend!

dueJtnKl4Km4Mzv_MpDqGw.text: Food was excellent and i like that you dont have a server so you save some cash. Service was fine.

GI_qr4Q7BBmgAPGCr7tUaw.text: Authentic!!  Having spent 20 years in the Middle East, I've always been on the lookout for great Middle Eastern fare, and Zeitouni gets it pretty right! We ordered the Falafel Platter, Shish Tawooq, and Shish Kabob Platters - and everything was very very good! Freshly made, great taste, fine texture - much more than what you'd expect when you're not in Dubai!   The ambience isn't great - more like a Middle Eastern McDonalds, the service tends to the slower side, but the food pretty much compensates for it all! Do go there if you want a quick bite - you won't be disappointed!

cGWzU-DVAm5RGRL9-Bl34g.text: Great restaurant, super good food. Very friendly service, this place is as clean as it gets and their sanitation grade is 99.5 I really don't think it can get any higher. Keep  up the great taste Zeitouni!!!!!!!!

FTHDZ9doDB5R9jwOPHGwQQ.text: My sister's boyfriend told me he was going to Earthfare to meet one of his friends that worked there and he thought they'd get something there. His buddy said, "no you got to check out this Lebanese place around the corner." So they checked it out and he was crazy about the Shawarma sandwich. For $5 it's a great dish. They also have a mixed platter that lets you try several of their meats with baba ganoush and tabouli which is very good. Lots of fresh meats vegetables and spices. And the staff is really great. I wish the atmosphere was a little different. It's a tad cramped and the lighting is too bright but that's being real nitpicky. Definitely worth your while if you are looking for unique cuisine that's budget friendly.

wBMp0OKpZ2GT4eMNRvWzOw.text: Good Mediterranean food.  Hummus was excellent.  Chicken Kabob was full of flavor.  Gyro tasted incredible.   Small restaurant with not a lot of seating but well worth checking out and when you are in the mood for middle eastern food - this is a solid choice.   Will definitely check out the grape leaves and Hanna the next visit.

iQcJZcvEWn3kmaIRnjPFgw.text: Chicken pita was unbelievably good!! Better than the old Middle Eastern Deli. Crisp marinated veggies. Perfectly marinated and grilled chicken in a thin pita. Wow.

1MlCmcxAiU2gLE3AeLASjA.text: Great prices and great execution. A solo friendly cook/server/owner? was taking care of all the guest and to go orders. Impressive. The decor could use a face lift and the color on the menus was less appealing, but that didn't matter compared to the taste of the food.

0XrUDfJtsnwVmwBJF5mP5g.text: Took the wife and kids here a few weeks ago and loved it. Great flavors, and very fresh. A little heavy on the lemon, but I prefer that.  Definitely worth it.

i5TqKmkZPgPejy9eSgOFQg.text: I recently came across this jewel. I travel to Charlotte often and am always on the lookout for good places to eat. Found this on yelp and decided to give it a try. Have tried the chicken platter and must say the chicken kebabs were cooked to perfection. The salad and humus were great too. Am definitely coming back.

oXcsh78c9aH98TRTzs2Zag.text: Great food. Better prices. A little gem. Just come in, an order. If you don't know what to order, just ask them. They're very friendly. Everything is prepared fresh daily. You won't regret it.

_0UBMIiX3F00nw9ID8G3iQ.text: After reading all the other reviews I was looking for a True Lebanese restaurant but was disappointed in what I found. I ordered chicken shwarma. I did not see a large kitchen skewer for them to trim the seasoned meat from, so assumed it was in the back of the house. The meat came without rice and was grilled with more of a barbecue taste than traditional shwarma. They asked me to choose two sides and told me they were out of baba ganoush. I chose hummus and fatoush. There was no parsley to garnish the fatoush or hummus. The dressing on the fatoush was closer to Italian than Lebanese. The hummus was bland. The restaurant was simple and clean with more of a sandwich shop feel. No hot Arabic tea - or any hot drinks were available. I would call this an American influenced Lebanese and not authentic. The cook/waiter was very polite and helpful. Rating this on authentic food quality I can only offer 3 stars. As a little short plate restaurant I would give it 4 for its attempt.

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. This gives you an idea of the tables and feel. The picture is just inside the strip mall door.

C-djG1BLhbtlxSPoay5WIA.text: I like the food.  My client from Lebanon says that this is like Lebanese  fast food as as far as the menu choices.  But we don't have any other Lebanese places in Charlotte.  So I will take what I can get.   Entrees range from $5.99 to $10.99 if you order a combo.

QXQdh6aIKvUriq_wc5uaIQ.text: Being of indian origin, and being born in the middle east, this is the closest thing to excellent lebanese food!  Very clean and wonderful service!  We ordered, shwarma platter with tabouleh and baba ghanouj, and the filafel sandwich.  Both were excellent!  So flavorful and delicious!  Highly recommend this place to anyone who is into arabic food.

tJs5v17A5wt6K6-FB2lO9w.text: Very good food, fresh. Not many places to sit and eat inside (especially during the lunch rush).

BhMMR1Sv_f0jQ74XiQo-aw.text: Ate here for the first time on a Friday. Was soooo good and inexpensive for the quality that we went back on Sunday. They weren't open on Sunday and no other Mediterranean compared.  That was months ago and we go back every time we possibly can.

8CSC0eKCLBp1kf9f_KvFgg.text: I heard a review on the local NPR station that said this was 1 of top 10 restaurants in Charlotte. I agree !  The chicken skewers were some of the best I've ever had.    The gyro's were pretty good too.  I definitely recommend Zeitouni's for casual food.

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

zP8BxiPEwK_Ld8g3WM1POw.text: Very authentic and family operated! Some of the best Mediterranean I've ever had! Highly recommend a visit!

-K332qFu7MPWZQ1AUVT9ww.text: I have only eaten here once but I didn't care for the food. The salad tasted like it came out of a bag and the hummus had too much garlic.

sCKE3sc6eFIre7x_kgP17g.text: Being from NYC I was bit hesitant about this place, cause lets face it nobody does it better than NY. However I saw all the great reviews this place got so decided to give it a shot. Let me tell you it was delicious!!! The falafel was full of flavor. Also they are not cheap with the servings. The only thing I didn't like was that our order took a while to be made. But at the end it was well worth it. I will definitely be going back.

5x8UAR1YwlMmqkSvh9MCnw.text: My husband and i have been eating here since it opened. The food is excellent and has remained consistently excellent. It's our standby for fast, wonderful, healthy food. Our favorite is the vegetarian platter-- excellent falafel and taboulleh. The family that owns and runs it is wonderful, too.

lprcAAs3mSC0bMXsIByTQw.text: Good Mediterranean food, a bit expensive compared to other places carrying similar cuisine but the location and the over crowding makes you think it really doesn't matter. The food again is good with options for vegetarians as well. The service is nice . Will recommend.

5WhHqKH91hIOpdba_nIShg.text: Great lunch spot with authentic Mediterranean food. Service was impeccable. A must visit if you're in the area

i_u1OG4C_06wfhN1DCL5Pw.text: This was average Mediterranean food. Yes, the skewers are cooked on a grill, but the gyro meat was the processed kind, not the kind that is shaved off a cone. I got a falafel sandwich, and there was a distinctive burnt flavor. The person I was with got the shawarma sandwich. Zeitouni only has beef shawarma, no chicken, and his sandwich was lacking a lot of flavor (I did try it myself). Better Mediterranean in Charlotte can be found at jasmine grill.

96-OOrtglLK5fAXw20_zjw.text: This is a good lunch spot. The food is fresh and flavorful. The platters and sandwiches are good and I love their Mediterranean salad. I definitely recommend this spot, especially for the lunch crowd looking for a good, quick meal.

BhjNUH4-AlOM1mSQkA957Q.text: Ate hear for the first time this week. I arrived at 12:45 and avoided the rush. It's a tiny space, but they do great things in that small area. I had the falafel platter and my wife had the gyros. Both were very good. I loved their tabbouleh. We left feeling very satisfied.   As other posters have mentioned, you will have to wait for your food. But, fer crissakes, stop your whinin' and relax.  Life's too short to always be in a hurry. Even so, we had a nice meal and were walking out the door by 1:10...only 25 minutes for lunch.   We'll be back!

QWrGElqTptQoICv0k7OfDQ.text: Love love love this place. Was introduced to it about 2 months ago and have been back many times. Some of my favorites are the Mediterranean salad with chicken, chicken gyro, and shish kabob. Also love the hummus and pita! Highly recommend!

HHNMsG2A6uTOvnzv103w4Q.text: Delicious and fresh. Came for the first time last week and already have been back 2 additional times. Try the Shish Kefta and Baba Ganoush!

kNGz97xn9JSXGSi7wrv-Qw.text: There are already a lot of positive reviews for Zeitouni, and it's for good reason.  I'll chime in with mine as well.  The bottom line to why this place is good, is the delicious quality at a fair price.  Some places tend to cut back on quality once the business is rolling for a while, but I've been going to this place since they opened, and thankfully thus far, it doesn't seem like they've fallen into that all too common mistake.  (Paying Cisco 25 cents less for your ingredients is NOT worth it and will turn away customers.. thanks to Zeitouni for being a place smart enough to realize this.)  Quality ingredients make a big difference to me when deciding whether or not I like a place.  I'm giving it 4.5 stars... just because food sometimes takes a while, and some of the staff could be more friendly.

6_3j3bCj5SVdUpv2ancmLg.text: I was looking forward to trying this place but was disappointed. I ordered a Gyro and it was 90% lettuce.  Maybe next time I'll try a platter but not in a hurry to go back

H1IOl1ZinDmHRIGoa_1l5Q.text: This place is really good.  The meat is marinated and so tender!  I didn't see the exact dish I wanted on the menu so they created it for me.  Not  many places will let you customize without making it a big deal but the owner is so nice and accommodating.

X_u2QXWmr0se-ASKChQxQw.text: After reading all the great review I decided to give it a try.  Thank you Yelpers for those honest reviews.  I was impressed and satisfied with my meal.  I had the beef and chicken Schwarma along with a Gyro, yes I was hungry.  Luckily I did order all that food as it was delicious.  Can't forget the baklava one of the best I have tasted.  It was crunchy as it should be and just sweet to the bite.  Great dinner that was well enjoyed by the family.

4euRy11hgPb9IuHiXRK2nw.text: Went here for lunch the other day and absolutely loved the food! Very authentic which I love. I got the tuwooq special which isn't on the menu but a friend told me about it. I will admit that the decor/cafeteria feel may need to be updated but hey, you take good food where you can find it.

cFgWbOc7LOeCz8JWhGlyqw.text: We tried this place fOr the 1 st time last Saturday,we did take out so I don't have comments about ambiance but man the food was fresh and delicious!! We had lamb , chicken and beef kebabs, it was tender and very well seasoned, the Fatush salad was yummy and the best babaganush I have had in ages!!! Hummus was good too and the falafels were super tasty, overall we loved it and definitely coming back!!!

WFmEz-_2OQ5KznszdMtiTg.text: Food is awesome. They have lots of choice. I love their falafel and Baklava. I suggest to try baklava.

Anpad_Ij-uv8aNp7hQYBrQ.text: Fantastic middle eastern food for a fair price.  Not a huge variety of dishes but every dish is crafted to perfection.  Alcohol availability is an advantage over other middle eastern restaurants in Charlotte.

Mxt5CwqpL4QXdJJUdyZMAw.text: Zeitouni's is one of my TOP places to eat in Charlotte.  The lamb gyros are to die for...they have a yogurt mint sauce instead of the Greek style cucumber tsatziki sauce.  The Lebanese version of this sauce is AMAZING.  The pita bread is always soft and the sandwich is to die for.  Also, the Shish Tawooq sandwich is basically a marinated chicken chunk and pickled veggie roll-up sandwich....kinda like a burrito but better.  The best part is the garlic mayo that comes on it....TO DIE FOR.  Get extra to dip the sandwich in.  Give this place a try, the high ratings are legit and the food is different but extremely addictive.

iL5qWpb6j4hQ4DW22J_Glg.text: Zeitouni is the best Mediterranean restaurant in Charlotte.  The food is always excellent.  Service is great and it is extremely reasonable.  I am so happy it is on my way home from work ha

L-4lq3XBjkW0dPvy7CaXRw.text: The dessert (lady fingers) is good. The chefs are nice, and i liked the vegetarian platter. But, i do not believe that the price point corresponds to what is delivered....

MmYJTmcP5oOm3lpr_SQPZQ.text: Its one of the nice places I being quick and courteous customer service...was a nice experience on yummy delicious eastern food...its a back again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Try new things with a friend ....

zrKAAB0FJdI3J32NQLbZ9A.text: Food is always fresh and cooked to order! Anytime you're in the Ballantyne area stop on by.

NV_i_mKZ1oQTUBY6AUtZew.text: Just moved to the area and decided to give zeitouni's a try, and I was not disappointed, they were busy during lunch, but they were pumping out food in a very timely manner and everything was delicious. Will definitely be returning

q3YIovgFGbbs_5r8qF65ZQ.text: Came here for lunch with a friend and they were busy! Everything went smooth. I ordered the chicken gyro with fries. It came out piping hot. I was super impressed and the food was delicious. Me and my friend ate our entire meal. I would definitely come back.

NOj_4qKrmVQx40GfnglV8g.text: The food was okay, but nothing great. I had the steak kabob, medium rare. The green pepper and onion were undercooked, the meat tough and overcooked. Rice did not have much flavor at all. The side salad was the "highlight". I don't remember what my companions had. Growing up in a Lebanese family, they did not expect food as good as Mom's, but they did expect better. The employees were friendly and professional. . Casual atmosphere, limited menu, order at the counter. They deliver the food to you. There is a table outside which is nice on cooler nights.

0-9nfh8iRtSRVr1f7xQBZA.text: Family owned restaurant so you know it's good! Most authentic Lebanese food in town hand down

6DWPlcmmKcpq8Kmvjl792A.text: Food is really good. But they don't really want you to stay and eat since the thermostat is way at 64 degrees. And the metal chairs are really cold to sit on at that temperature.  Next time I will do take out

jif87fuoRLzNyVN542E5Vg.text: A happening dinner spot with good options for vegetarians, tasty food, friendly service. They explained things on the menu patiently and were quick to point out vegetarian options. Loved the Middle Eastern music, particularly as it provided a little respite from the fact that I'm living in the surrounding business park for a week! Some of the items were a tad acidic, but that might just be the type of cuisine. Give it a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

9FENMFBYIsq1hEG5ydMKvw.text: Absolutely amazing food and great service! The chicken is always SO tender and flavorful. The beef is pretty good too, but since I prefer chicken that's my usual favorite. Their Mezza platter is perfect for lunch - especially if you don't want to eat a very heavy meal but still need something substantial. The potatoes are to die for! Definitely my favorite Mediterranean joint in Charlotte. Haven't been disappointed with any of the food items on their menu so far.

xEkmqglIWxYFU1rK0Cdaqg.text: I just ate here recently for the first time in a long time and unfortunately this visit was not as good as my prior visits.   I ordered a cup of lentil soup to start and it was super salty. Very disappointing!  I also ordered a falafel wrap with a side of fries. The falafel was meh, the fries were meh. The falafel did not have much flavor and there was a lot of pita bread. They had some sort of Tahini  or hummus in the pita that again wasn't very flavorful. Also, the fries tasted like frozen.    And overall value was not good... I think my total with a drink came to over $15. For that price I could have gone to the Kabob Grill at Stonecrest and had a much better quality of food.

GskDeD109XYNZ83S0oznEw.text: If i had the chance to give the 10 stars I would the food is amazing the staff is great and friendly!  I can literally eat here everyday!

WatgcDWekarGMgFYQ4zQcg.text: Every once in awhile we bring the dog down to get some exercise at Zoom Room. This time we were hungry for some lunch. I'm lazy so I'll eat at any chain restaurant in the area, but my wife needs to eat 'special' food (and she needs to eat it now!).   We found Zetouni's in the same plaza as Earth Fare and Zoom Room. We ordered Chicken Gyros.  The chicken was nice and tender and the sauce was great. It was a good lunch wrap for sure. We also got some hummus, which was...hummus. I'm not sure I've ever had above average hummus, honestly.   If I needed lunch and was in the neighborhood I'd check out Zetouni's again, but I probably wouldn't make a special trip for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Gyro and hummus

DCFi7bhhdJrOzTsWDY6lLw.text: Whenever I find myself in this neck of the woods Zeitouni is always on my radar. So when my mom and I had made plans to go the Ballantyne Hotel for a spa day, this was a clear choice for our pre-spa lunch. It had been quite a while since I had been and while I do realize this is not the best Mediterranean food on the planet they have a very solid offering and do some of these extremely well. I love the option of the platters since I can never pick only one thing to order and I like being able to try a bunch of different things. For the platters you get to choose 1 out of a couple of proteins, 1 dip (hummus or babba ghanouj), and 1 salad.  My mom and I got a falafel platter with hummus and fatoush salad and one with shish tawooq (grilled marinated chicken), babba ghanouj, and tabbouleh and shared so we could try a bit of everything. The presentation of the falafel platter was really nice, not sure why they didn't do the same thing for the chicken platter but oh well. Everything was very good and while not as inexpensive as other comparable mediterranean spots it was a reasonable price for the amount of food that you get. The standouts were the tabbouleh and the babba ghanouj. I probably wouldn't get the hummus again though as it was rather bland. Usually I am a falafel girl but the chicken was the better of the two proteins. Only other note is that they should probably give a little more pita bread on the platters. I will be back again for sure next time I am in the Ballantyne area.

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Falafel platter with hummus and fatoush
Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shish Tawooq (grilled chicken) platter with tabbouleh and baba ghanouj YUM

ZnlHKJxsIkY0Sy-pi9QiOQ.text: Amazing experience!  I live in California and tried so many Mediterranean Restaurants there, however I never tasted such food. We tried several plates as sharing ( fatoush salad, potato harra,tawouk special, falafel, hommus..) and each plate was special and better than the other.. Great ambiance, friendly staff, tasty filling food with great prices!

EJaQfNIKcbeQTQmLa7S3Ig.text: This place is a hidden gem. The hummus is creamy and fresh, the pita soft and chewy and my fave the shish tawooq chicken kabob is so flavorful. Great little place!

lb8ihnELJpiFZ25YHbakrA.text: This is hands down the best Mediterranean in Charlotte. I don't even live close but this restaurant is always worth the drive, I end up here at least every couple weeks. The shish tawooq is my go to order, it's perfect, just the right amounts of every ingredient. Definitely give this spot a try if you haven't, it's delicious!

5HlhvP4eDX0gSKxmridwdw.text: Chicken gyro is unlike any other! Deliciously marinated, juicy and tender. I do the combo. Hummus is good too. I like to dip my French fries in sriracha. My boyfriend gets falafel also.

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

eCi4C6j5IDUAGJaECTsosQ.text: Great food! I'd rather drive all the way to ballantyne to get Greek food here than eat at Zoe's kitchen down the street. It's very fresh!

qmYULVzLyvjeeINXXTr_VA.text: Absolutely fantastic falafel. That is the whole reason to come here. I would even put it ahead of La Shish Kabob. Very affordable and so good. Highly recommended.   Tabouleh and Shawarma are good too.   Service isn't always great. Don't expect a smile from certain people. However, the owner is incredibly nice. Easy parking. Music can be a little annoying. Not great atmosphere either. Better for take out.

XQOmYi7v5iVDGJAtlCTAbQ.text: My wife and I went there for the first time in Friday night. The food was inexpensive and very good. Not the best ambiance, but we didn't mind

GBXRqujJxJO9EJDlNIseaw.text: Have eaten here twice now for lunch.  Both times had the lamb gyro - which is pretty good.  It's not too big, so perfect size for lunch.  The taziki sauce is a touch on the sour side for my liking, however, the ingredients are fresh and the staff is very friendly and prompt.  The hummus and pita was disappointing.  Paid for extra pita as 4 triangles are never enough!  However, they don't toast or warm the pita when served with hummus.  (The gyro pita IS warmed/toasted)  This ruined it for me.  Can't even tell you if the hummus was good as they lost me on the cold pita.  Eager to go back as the kabobs and salad look awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb gyro

Xh7hWZrTjAKIhwTnjsSvYg.text: I stopped in on the recommendation of a neighbor.  The atmosphere was more Subway than exotic but the food and service was all that and a bag of chips.  I started with a side of Babba Ganouj as an appetizer.  It was so creamy and tasty with the pita bread, I could have made a meal out of it.  Next was a combination platter that included three kinds of meats.  Shish Kefta, Shish Tawooq, and Shish Kabob.  The meats were accompanied by Fatoush (a salad of greens, tomatoes and pita chips) and Hummus.  The meats were seasoned very well and were extremely tender and juicy.  The salad had a complexity of flavors accented with Mint and spices.  I really liked the flavor combinations.  This was my first time really experiencing Middle Eastern food.  Iman, the owner, spent time explaining the dishes to me and explained that this is authentic and cooked just like the old country.  No dumbing down or "Americanization" of the food here. It's the real deal!  One of the things I'd like to see them add to the menu would be lamb.  This would really round it out.  I'll be back!!

Wj7qRw3cjvlmhPXENsYATA.text: Wow, all five star reviews so far!  Guess I won't derail the train on that... my only complaint is the classification here on Yelp of this restaurant being in the "Quail Hollow" neighborhood.  Although it's not officially Ballantyne... it's closer to there than Quail Hollow.  Anyway... we just stopped there for a quick lunch pick up and got the Shawarma "sandwich" and a Gyro and both were VERY GOOD!!  My only regret was not getting a second Shawarma or fries to go with it.  It was delish!!  The Gyro was loaded with meat and very nicely seasoned.  We will be going back there again... and again.

wiJFSNWliI0bfLRps0ronw.text: I was craving Persian food and I stumbled upon this place in my search. I ordered the kefta platter with fatoush and hummus. Overall I enjoyed the food but it was definitely not the best I've had. I was born and raised in Chicago and we're known for our food. After moving to Charlotte, I know why people have been saying this. Good food is hard to find in Charlotte.  The kefta, fatoush and hummus were all pretty good but the rice was *plain* and the bread was thin and limp much like a tortilla. The other thing that annoyed me was that they piled everything high onto a small plate. Service was good, nothing to mention there but they are really nice people.  If I cannot find another place, this might end up as my go-to for now. If this place was in Chicago it would be a place I would visit only if I were in the area.

icGHElJaRGYFHPa4fRQruA.text: This place is great! I've been three times now, and while I want to try different menu items the Mediterranean Chicken Salad is too amazing to pass up! I crave it the moment I leave and that craving is not satisfied until I'm back for more! The chicken is moist (yes, I went there!), perfectly-seasoned, and blends well into an already delicious salad.  The service is always friendly and helpful and the location is kept very clean.   If you live or work in the Ballantyne area you HAVE to try Zeitouni Grill out!

d-RYL9MfNoHoe8spcZQ2HA.text: Most delicious Mediterranean food in Charlotte. No ambiance, so perhaps not the best place for "date night" but everything is flavorful. I love eating the vegetarian mezza platter, even though I'm not a vegetarian. Truly it's more of a take out or lunch with colleagues ambiance but The food is DELISH

pzjj8TkmWgBsLuqwhYXpCw.text: I've lived in Charlotte for 4+ years now, and I keep hoping I'll find a good Mediterranean restaurant somewhere in the Weddington/Ballantyne/Blakeney area.  Based on the reviews for Zeitouni, I decided to give it a try.  This was a True disappointment.  The shwarma platter was $10.99 and looked like a kid size portion.  The shwarma sandwich was actually more food than the platter and much cheaper.  Sadly, the food was luke warm, and the pita that the sandwich was wrapped in actually felt like they had just pulled it out of the cooler--it was cold, which subsequently made the meat cool quickly.  The fattoush salad was not much more than some iceberg lettuce with feta crumbled on top, and it was dripping in dressing.  The young man who took our order at the register was all business, which is fine, but a smile and a friendly greeting would have been nice.  All in all, this is fast food masquerading as Mediterranean, but priced like a mid-level restaurant.  Also, the pictures don't look anything like what is actually given to you.  I won't be going back.

XxvZhIOKMGDkwfexbzmPpw.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. The food is phenomenal! Hands down the best chicken I've ever had - super fresh! I've tried several items off the menu and I have never been disappointed. Not only is it delicious food, but it is artfully plated. It's beautiful, reasonably priced, and delicious. It's easy to see that the family who owns and runs this fabulous place is passionate about their craft.

7_XssPBhEOU9ycIuY-ylGQ.text: Great food. Loved the shish tawooq sandwich. Add hot sauce and it'll make it even better

2RGiFXzmOeObodfiQ9FVZg.text: Everything here is fantastic. The menu is diverse, reasonably priced, and down right tasty. My parents hail from the Middle East and this is authentic. My Lebanese grandmother would have loved this place.   Their hummus is excellent, the grilled kabobs delightful, by my personal favorite is the falafel. Perfectly crispy on the outside and moist on the inside with fresh toppings. I highly recommend you try this little gem.

cohMRJ2aQSJO2ufyHt_WHQ.text: I have eaten here a few times for my wife. The staff is not very helpful at all. If you want a whole wheat pita, you have to buy the whole pack plus pay full price for the wrap. Bunch of thieves beware

IYMeMzPXI-dNUlOGXLz4tQ.text: Great food! My husband was a little hesitant because it is counter service but don't let that deter you. We grabbed a great bottle of Lebanese wine and a table outside while we waited (very short wait) for our food. I had the mezza platter with falafel, grape leaves, potato  harra, babba ghanouj, and fatoush...everything was outstanding!  My husband had the falafel platter with hummus and Mediterranean salad. ..also all delicious! We will definitely be back!

ettkHNDbdhMb4uRmG3i9_w.text: The food is fresh and perfectly grilled.  Lebanese wine & beer is very tasty and smooth!

4bxXOAQm_9nW28Jx5XjOyA.text: Please note that this is not a fancy locale.  If you want fancy, go to some other Lebanese place in Mecklenburg county that has a pretty restaurant and pretty mediocre food. Zeitouni is not pretty, but the food . . .  aah, the food!  Who wants fancy tables and walls when the food is cooked to order, fresh and delicious!  The Mr. says we have never had anything bad from the menu.  The Mrs. wholeheartedly agrees!  It's ALL good. We are not coffee drinkers, but the freshly-made coffee smells heavenly.  The baklava is yummy. The staff behind the counter is friendly, helpful, and accommodating. We happily return and return and return . . .  The Mr. and Mrs. love Zeitouni. .

9ghno8uqA-pvWyegVGoAkQ.text: Yummy, yummy, yummy!  The shawarma was delicious, and the baba ghanoush was simple and satisfying.  We were originally supposed to go to another restaurant in the same area, but we saw Zeitouni and thought, "Ooh, that looks good!"  And it was, my friend!  The people were very friendly, and came by twice to see if we were enjoying the food.  It's a little restaurant with BIG taste!  Can't wait to try the falafel.  I haven't had a good falafel since we left Raleigh!

IAoiLTpnOOgOuBJJwAAXxA.text: Great food. I had the chicken tawooz and tabouleh. Highly recommend it. Baklava is one of the best I've eaten Charlotte. Highly recommend it. What I don't like is the quantity of rice they give you. They could be a little more generous.

w91pmcLpi35QBMnJ13MjGw.text: I was pleasantly surprised with how amazing my meal was!  I got the Mezza Platter, and loved it.  I didn't have to make any substitutions to make it vegan either!  The platter came with 2 falafel patties, and was the BEST falafel I have ever had!  They weren't dried out like they frequently are at a lot of places, and they were well seasoned.  I also had baba ganoush, fatoush salad, stuffed grape leaves, and potatoes harra.  AMAZING!  I will definitely be back soon.

VnRpKhNP3dR5NzRAm2zaZQ.text: Great Mediterranean food! My friend has been raving about this restaurant for months and I am glad I tagged along.   The restaurant itself is off the main road near a shopping center and has a very casual atmosphere. Upon entering you place an order at the counter and on to find seating. There is not a ton of seating so if it gets busy you might have someone in line standing over you.   I ordered the shish tawooq with babba ghanouj. The tawooq is similar to a wrap but with pita bread. The marinated chicken is delicious and babba ghanouj is worth getting. I can see why it gets high reviews.

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

mG6A_NTlKfjY1a49w2VZ9A.text: This is one of my top 3 Mediterranean restaurants. The staff are awesome and friendly and ready to make recommendations. The food is always fresh, tasty and fast.  I always get the Mezza which has stuffed grape leaves, potato harra and falafel, I add the salad and hummus.  It is so filling and they have the BEST falafel in Charlotte!  My wife got the shawarma for the first time and WOW the meat was delicious! It is different than the shawarma I've had at other restaurants and this is also going to be a favorite for me!  My wife also prefers their hummus to other places we frequent. It has a very creamy texture with out being to thin.  I am looking forward to our next visit.

Ef30RULomWsHS4e8L85wug.text: Very good price for the quality of food here.   Their shawarma is good, and their falafel is decent, albeit a bit hard. If you've never tried a zaatar flatbread, this is the place to try one.  Their grape leaves have a bit to be desired, but overall they're decent.  If you want Arabic coffee, make sure it's prepared by an Arab. Whenever I get their coffee and it's not prepared by one of the few Arab staff members there's a ton of cardamom powder in the coffee.         .    . :(

ylPsLOkhxXhIPqfiKtZIvQ.text: Zeitouni Grill is a hidden gem in the Toringdon Market Strip Mall. I've been out to this area several times but never really shopped area in the area. I'm so glad I found Zeitouni Grill on Yelp's Top 100 from 2018.   During my visit the restaurant was busy but not super busy. My group was able to find a table and easily place an order. The atmosphere is very casual and family friendly. I can tell they have loads of regulars.   I ordered the Gyro Platter with Babba Ghanouj and Falafel. I judge Mediterranean restaurants hard core on their falafel and theirs passed with flying colors. The falafel had great crunch and amazing flavor. The gyro meat also was very flavorful! The basically melts in your mouth. I was overwhelmed with the portions and had to take a good amount home.   I was hoping that my meal came out on one of the wooden boards but it didn't. Only a couple of the platters come out in those boards but the cashier I believe her name was Katie said she would take care of me next time!   I can't wait to go back and try some of the other items on the menu and especially some of the desserts!!!

QuX3gPUrGQMKu3WCYVvTtA.text: Delicious fast casual, easy to order and food out quickly. It's a great choice for a quick meal without sacrificing quality.

00npac0WeTz802Sog6jMgA.text: Wow, this place just rocks...as I wipe the tears of joy from mine eyes, the rapture that consumed me from biting into the chicken and the falafel and the baba ghanoush are making it hard to type because my hands are still shaking:).  But seriously,  some of the best Mediterranean food I've ever had.  My wife had the Mezza Platter that had falafel, grape leaves, potatoes,  and fatoush.  She loved ever microscopic crumb as she licked the wooden plank that it was served on.  Son had chicken kebab and loved it and I had the chicken gyro with baba ghanoush.  The chicken was perfectly grilled and the tzatziki sauce  was so fresh I had to slap it.  The interior of the restaurant is not elaborate nor decorative but its enough and is functional.  Great customer service and friendly atmosphere.  If you're in the area you must give this place a whirl!

gppjMBpnkqsAw7tseCI9Kg.text: Love this place. The tabbouleh is fresh and properly spiced. Same with the shawarma and kebabs. Ask for hot sauce if you like it spicy.  Place is clean and easy to get to. Service is also good.  This place is in the top three of my all time favorites for chicken shawarma. The others being in Toronto and D.C. , neither of which is near here.

yO6D-WnJV4iygdYpZu99AQ.text: Ahhhhhmazing!!! I'm so in love with this place. The customer service, the workers, the music playing in the background, the food - it's all good! They have a very simple menu of the most popular Mediterranean / Greek food items and a description of them in case you weren't familiar with the cuisine.   My son loves gyros and we had time to kill so we stopped in for lunch. There's an open flame grill cooking your meats to order right in front of you. You order at the register and have a seat, waiting for the food to come out. I ordered the Mixed Grill which came with 3 different meat kabobs over rice along with a side salad and baba ganouj (roasted eggplant dip.) my son ordered a gyro with hummus.  We fell in love at first bite. My son ate ALL of his food and took some of mine too. Growing teenage boys have an insatiable appetite! Let me tell you about my food - all of It was so friggin delicious. By far the BEST kabobs I've ever had in Charlotte. The steak was tender, the chicken was full of flavor and so moist but the best kabob was the minced meat. I think it was a lamb and beef mix - yummy yummy. We cleaned our plates. I mean, we literally polished our plates clean. It was that good. My only gripe is that they're all the way in Ballantyne which is a good 45 minute drive from home. Maybe that's a good thing cause if they were any closer, I'd be spending way too much money there. Their portions are filling but it's so good that the greedy part of me would just keep eating even after I'm full. Which is what happened today.

l8QK78Lxerxrr7zpQod5Bw.text: Very unfriendly owner and staff. Very slow and poor customer service. Always claims to run out of tabbouleh so you will have to substitute it with another item that is less desirable. The portions are incredibly small for the prices that they charge. The side orders are served in very small styrofoam bowls. None of the staff with long hair handling food had their hair mesh on. Make sure that you ask for a receipt and read it because the owner will avoid giving it to you and will most likely charge you for something that you didn't order; especially if your party is more than two.

8Ye6csar2kW6umx5_ussgA.text: Amazing! Not kidding this was bomb. The food was fresh, hot and full of FLAVOR. The place was pretty busy, but the service was amazing and the place was clean and plenty of tables to sit and eat at. I really enjoyed my meal, I tried a a few options and none of them were a disappoint! The staff was professional friendly and always hard at work, you can tell they cared about their job and the customers. I can't wait to come back and have more. Thank you!

UgY32RwZAlQWjWzsChU2Iw.text: This is a GREAT place to stop for a Lebanese / Mediterranean style meal!  I cannot get enough of these places near my home (no, really, this makes one!)...   The gentlemen behind the counter were all very helpful with describing and helping us to choose menu items... I had a fresh and delicious plate of comfort food in the form of the gyro platter... I left full, happy, and completely contented!!  I am very glad you all are SO near my home, and I will be stopping by for take-out regularly!! :)

Z3Eh8GTcC0XINDn6x30FHA.text: Omg! Came out to N.C to visit and wanted something different to eat.  So we stopped here at the Zeitouni Grill. I'm so glad we stopped here. The food the atmosphere the staff are just the best people ever. Polite friendly everything great. Now the food is another story, it was awesome I loved everything about it. Fresh delicious & tasty! Cfx8WWjtwLCs46Qxvdcj-g.text: I'd say I'm stingy with 5 stars, but I just don't know what they could possibly do better. It is a "stand in line, pay, then sit and wait for the food" place which I prefer since you don't have to figure cost of up.  Firstly,  falafel!! This is the best falafel ever, crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, perfect flavor and texture and what presentation! 1ECJtzpX7rJUkJ7jl_kxhw.text: Incredible food! Everything we tried was fantastic. Would definitely recommend the Mezza Platter for a bit of variety. tc5-fRHKJdA7KQPah165cQ.text: I don't consider myself to be a Mediterranean food expert, but if Zeitouni is any indication of the caliber of this region's food, then I'm relocating tomorrow. Some of the best Greek/Lebanese food in Charlotte.  I know the following to be True...the meat (all types) is flavorful and never tough; it's absolutely delicious. Even the bed of jasmine rice is delicious on its own. The tabbouleh is awesome and refreshing and their Mediterranean salad is just as good as any. The hummus and pita bread are a some of the tastiest I have ever had. One piece of advice...GET THE POTATOES.   It's nothing you haven't had before, but it's done to very well every single time you eat here. It's usually pretty fast unless you're going during peak lunch hour. You will never have to wait long any time after 1-2PM. My only complaint is that it's very small inside and does not have tons of seating available.   Try it out and you won't be disappointed. 5/5 because they know what they are and consistently execute.

q6ygDiFoQvS4BCGRzoP9rA.text: I had some of my coworkers bring me food from here for the 1st time during lunch. Even though they took a little long to come back (so my food was cold) when took my first bite I was in food heaven!  I had to come back quickly so I stopped in again for dinner and what do you know. The food was STILL amazing!  Needless to say I love this place!

lIzP6X2NbQyrGkBnW8C90g.text: If there was a way to put a zero I would. I ordered felafel and a drink. 25 minutes later after several other customers after me got their orders I am still waiting.   I finally asked for a refund. Was told it would be ready in 3 more minutes. I make my own felafel a lot. It doesn't take 30 minutes. The worst part is that they were totally indifferent. No apology, very unprofessional. Was my first visit there and definitely my last.

FOjZgLFp3TOqnoeRTA8--w.text: I just wanted to take the time to say how amazing this place is! With the food and superb customer service is what keeps me coming back time after time. All the staff members always have a smile on their face and you can tell they enjoy what they do. My favorite dish here is the chicken gyro platter I always pair it with the outstanding hummus and the fatoush salad. I can't forget my favorite side dish! The potato harra OMG!! If you love Mediterranean food you will love this place!

RGIM66PFmZU-kQeANuc5uA.text: Amazing food. You have to try this place. The falafel platter was cooked to perfection. The chicken shawarma was full of flavor.  For dessert, the baklava is not overly sweet.

Y17JhP56E_mPFN_opHieyQ.text: So, I'm from Detroit originally.  Among other things, Detroit is home to more people of Middle Eastern descent than perhaps anywhere else in North America.  As a result, Detroit also a wide array of great Middle Eastern restaurants.  So one could imagine how disappointing it was to land in Charlotte 5 years ago only to find there weren't any really good Middle Eastern restaurants.  (Or if there were, they certainly weren't anywhere near me.)  I had the opportunity to try Zeitouni last week.  Would have loved for this to be more of a sit-down, waiter service place where I could comfortably stay for a while in a booth and have rounds of food brought to me.    But no big deal.  Ordering at the counter was easy and the staff was friendly.  The food is prepared right in front of your eyes so you can see that it is made to order and fresh.  My meal took maybe 10 minutes and was hot, fresh and...DELICIOUS!  I ordered a falafel sandwich combo that included a drink and a side of hummus.  In addition I ordered a greek salad.  The falafel was cooked to perfection. Not mushy or overdone.  Simply perfect.  And the tanhini was applied judiciously, adding some nice nutty flavor to the dish without dripping all over my hands.  The hummus was rich and creamy (perhaps not as much garlic as I like), but just so FRESH.  And the salad was great.  An abundance of crumbled feta cheese and a really wonderful dressing on top of fresh lettuce and green pepper.    I will definitely be back.

1E9auPXWVSEuz1PGwdfvHA.text: Tried this place for the first time today and it was delicious! The gyro meat had great flavor and was tender and juicy. I wouldn't say the humus was the best I've ever had but it was good enough. Great food, great service...I'll definitely be back!

b4mh50tP6XXgBBkYGnhu9A.text: Went today for a quick lunch. Everything about this place was awesome! My girlfriend and I were unsure what to get and the guy at the register was very helpful. It had been some time since I had a good gyro so I went with that. I've never had stuffed leaves so I decided to try a side of those. The guy at the register recommended their chicken sandwich, which my friend got along with the side of eggplant. Everything was so fresh and delicious! Looking forward to going again to try something different.

MIVqQcJGrHbttGO9PZekEQ.text: We split two platters (Mixed and Mezza) and the Zataar flatbread, so we could try more things. Things we would get again: ANY of the meats (all cooked perfectly and so flavorful!), the potato harra, the fatoush salad, the hummus, and the tabbouleh. I would skip the Zataar, the Babba Ghanouj and the Falafels. Also, we tried all four types of baklava, and I felt they were all somewhat dry, and butter was an extremely prominent flavor, but the long rolled ones were the best imo. All said and done, we would definitely come back.

lgrxdDTvV4X22BXn1XhF3w.text: One of the best falafel I had tried. Accompanying tabbouleh was really good and fresh too.   Why not 5 starts ?  Because Pita served was cold. However Upon request they heated in microwave and accomodated us.   Babaghanoj had smoky flavor but very close to taste coming out of can. Would pass on that one next time.   Overall great stop for quick lunch , go again for falafel

1VD6N64hVkMyzyKfAZXmwA.text: This place has the best falafels! We have dinner here probably once a week and the food and service is always top notch! Everything we have tried on their menu is always good, the chicken special sand which is also another favorite and must try!

N36mT7HTWEhC9tpF2Eeg3g.text: Yum, yum, yummy!   What a gem this place is. I haven't been to the establishment yet, but this review is for the take out. My parental units dined in and called to ask if I'd like some grub - hell yah!   I had the Shish Tawoowq platter with a side of babba ghanouj. The rice was incredibly fluffy and full of flavor, the chicken was perfectly grilled and tender and the babba was delish, wait it was Delish - with a capital D! They were able to get the bitterness out of the eggplant and it was extra creamy.   The portion was huge, I was able to have left overs for lunch - there is a bargain in its self.   Places like this is allowing me to have faith in the flavors of the QC -- we may never have an authentic Mexican restaurant, but here my friends you will find the real deal.

fm2WPYtSIV3tBP3aL-bDPw.text: Very good. Great choice and the Lebanese beer was a plus. I never take the time to rate anything but the food compelled me.

IIB0TR17IxrwyNs7tfYk3A.text: Great, authentic arabic food.  We got the shwarma & mixed platter.  Both were super good.  Friendly service & the waitress explained each thing on the menu (even though we are pretty familiar with arabic food). :-)  Will definitely be coming here more frequently.

v5t0pY3wYszC4wyOOY-YkA.text: Quick, delicious, and fairly authentic middle eastern food. It's a good quick spot for lunch!

VWjyQ1P77i4nhXjkOfzPKg.text: The kabob was absolutely delish!!!  Very impressed with the food quality.  I had chicken kabob, basmati rice and baba gonoush... Along with some grape leaves.  I definitely recommend this spot if you love middle eastern cuisine.

RpirmQ0e57XvC_u-3F1uOQ.text: Great place , healthy food, chicken was awesome .  The reviews are right on point .  Awesome restaurant for a quick and super good light meal.

71HpF58TW314js7BAdG67g.text: Very good Mediterranean fare. Very flavorful and authentic. A small family run spot that clearly cares about quality. Worth a stop.

1NEtGoMk9X7oWEmFLEsbkg.text: Phenomenal.   My mouth could not handle all the delight of my chicken platter dish. You can just tell the ingredients are WHOLE and FRESH. Expect clean flavors and mouth watering, juicy chicken.   The eggplan humus -- oh my god, to die for.

8oEjetrauCiRz9f8XLQs_A.text: Um...YUM! Haven't had a gyro in years and I never remember them tasting sooo gooood! Cant wait to try other things on the menu.  I will be back!

VAH6I6y6rdg31YmHJJ2mjA.text: Since moving back home to NC from Detroit, I have been on a quest for great Lebanese food, without sacrificing the amazing quality and reasonable prices of the mom-and-pop places all over SE Michigan. I must say Zeitouni's rivals the best of Detroit and that's a difficult task to accomplish.  My favorites for lunch are the Shish Tawook and the Shish Kefta sandwiches. Honestly, you can try anything on the menu and you won't be disappointed.  Enjoy every last morsel of goodness!

jNdZZL4GtkaJ34ef3SBL2g.text: Crazy good! Charlotte needed a good casual place like this. Food is very fresh and sooo good. When I told the woman at the counter I had never been there before she made recommendations and helped me out. Unlike other places that roll their eyes or just look anoyed.  I took a menu back to work. Highly recommend to everyone!

TK4S3Xa7YYLb6wNfKpkayw.text: OPEN Kitchen!  Consistently Good Food and Always Great Service!  One of the things I LOVE most about this place is they have always allowed a simple substitution!  Listen yelpers:  Do you really want rice with that!???  No! ! !  Get something GOOD!  Potatoes Hara is my suggestion or maybe you could have an original thought, NO don't do that, copy me, PLEASE Copy Me and ask nicely : "would you please substitute the Rice for Potatoes Hara"?  You will not have to drop my name... They know me as Matt (not Super Drew, just Matt and not Just Matt... Matt... Matt who likes Hat (s)K!  I have eaten almost everything on the menu and I have eaten almost all of it twice.  Wraps are Good, Kabobs are BETTER!!!   Fattoush was A-OK better than many!  Tabouleh has been prepared to order each time.  I have heard that it is better (proper) to have it this way, as opposed to pre-made.  All the Desserts are Good or Better... get the Baklava!   Lebanese Coffee, they say (like Turkish Coffee with Cardamom).  So it is Better than "Turkish Coffee", because I like the Cardamom (Might make a List about it)... Since this is MY review I do not need to say "it is my opinion" this is MY Review!   It takes me about 6 hours to drink one serving (you get TWO) and I can not spell anythij for the rest of the day... My Doctor said it is common, though not as common, which is a GREAT way to say Rod0, you are a weirdo, hmmm, ok, I'll take that as a compliment!

H14eEwPGqng81qXXc65RJA.text: Our family favorite Mediterranean Rest. You cannot go wrong with the entire menu. The Gyro meat is so moist and tasty. Their dolma  (stuffed grape leaves) is very good.

-ecgWXTsIZf9DgDsIRMh4w.text: I had been asking the Mr if we could come here for quite a while. During a foray into the adjacent Dippin Dots, I saw people filing into this joint and thought it was worth a yelpy lookup. It has deservedly acquired four and a half stars from the yelp community and here's why:  * Education: They take the time to explain the meat/entree offerings in a way that doesn't demean, but offers insight into which you might prefer. You can also see the skewers of meat right in front of you in a visually *enticing* cooler. They also have detailed explanations of all those tongue-twisting Mediterranean food descriptors, e.g. shawarma, fatoush, tabbouleh...  * Variety: Please note that vegetarians can actually grow both fat and happy here. From a simple hummus to lumps of perfectly crispy falafel or perhaps baba ganoush, eat your fill. As I didn't sample the meat options (we all know why), I had to depend on the Mr's refined palate, which suggests that the chicken skewers are the way to go. They also serve Lebanese beer and wine. Cheers!  * Atmosphere: It's Mediterranean quick-casual. FINALLY. You don't have to go somewhere promising Friday night belly dancing in order to partake in this savory, fresh fare. I, whose belly will remain shirted, am delighted about the atmosphere. Nothing at all fancy here. Simple plates, self-serve soda/tea fountain, friendly staff (who recognized us when we returned only two days after our initial visit).  * Food: Delicious. An excellent choice for a Ballantyne-area lunch or quick dinner that won't leave you feeling bloated and ready for a nap. Great value as well. I'll probably not order falafel anywhere else, because my poor, spoiled taste buds would likely revolt.  All in all, this spot is definitely worth a visit. If you live in the area, it's an added bonus. No frills, just great Mediterranean food. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tabbouleh

Qe20pKsuR9YwBqmIeXdLXw.text: Great local establishment of Mediterranean food. We had the chicken shawarma platter, which comes with a heaping size hummus, pita, and side salad with great tasting dressing. Healthy, low carb, fresh and family owned? YES! YES! YES! YES! YES! Limited seating and long-ish lines, but the line moves and they work it out. Love it and can't wait to go back!

VGHcCTNCJBBgaHjOotMKXg.text: My family is Greek so I love Mediterranean food and love finding a good spot to go. Since moving to the area this year I've already been here a handful of times and it has been amazing each time. We've tried several things on the menu and they're all so good! My parents and in-laws are big fans now too!

M75mfLi4Sw5X44VjZHShmg.text: My fiance and I love this hidden gem off Johnston road. We especially love the zattar app, the tabbouleh, the mixed platter and even the gyros.

DO6tppS6WSWNQNnOhV_khA.text: My husband has been jonesing for Zeitouni ever since he started reading the reviews here on Yelp. We went a couple of weeks ago on a weeknight, and I have to say, I'm impressed.  Having traveled to Italy and Greece, we are not strangers to Mediterranean food. Still, it was refreshing to have one of the young men in the restaurant meet our eyes as soon as we walked in, and ask if we'd like an explanation of their menu. He took us over to the case and showed us their kabobs, as well as their sides. He explained how we could order the different combinations, and then left us to confer amongst ourselves.  We each ordered a platter. I ordered the chicken kabobs, my husband ordered the trio of kabobs. We ordered different sides in order to sample them all: hummus for me, babba ghanouj for my husband.  We sat down to wait at a table, and after a few minutes they brought out our orders. Interestingly, our kabobs came with the wrong sides on the plates, but frankly this wasn't an issue since we were just doing a big old taste test of everything we could get.  An older gentleman (perhaps the owner?) came by to present me with a garlic aioli sort of dip for the chicken. It was DELICIOUS and so garlicky! We asked for more, and asked what they called it. "Chicken sauce," he said, with a laugh as he gave away the secret recipe of garlic and fresh mayonnaise. I don't care how simple it was, I loved it.  The food was fresh and delicious. The staff was smiling and friendly. I couldn't ask for more from a restaurant. Well - maybe if it was sit down service with menus, but I won't dock them for that. Zeitouni is what it is - a counter service restaurant. Their food shines beyond "counter service" which implies almost a fast food style. Zeitouni is not "fast food" in my opinion. It's delicious, flavorful and fresh, designed to be savored. So it's a bit of a disconnect, but I forgive them for that because well, if you taste this food, you'd forgive just about anything else.  My recommendation for dining at Zeitouni is that you call ahead and order delicious meals to enjoy in your home. If you're looking for a tasty and fresh lunch, or out for a quick dinner, it's an okay place ambiance-wise, in which to enjoy it, but the fast food feel might turn you off for a date night out.   Regardless of how you enjoy their food, it is amazingly delicious food that is meant to be enjoyed. We'll be back again and again, but likely with a carryout bag to savor in our home. Zeitouni's food, and it's staff are elevated far beyond the atmosphere you'll find when you walk in.

The Mediterranean salad had good ingredients but I felt there was way too much salt and vinegar on it for my taste.   The cashier was nice and they bring your food out to you and I did enjoy the service.   Overall, I was looking to eat something healthy but also satisfying and this hit the spot.

LmqpUBVjh7A0RUQlFmNj2Q.text: OK, I walked in around 4pm on a Wednesday afternoon, so I can let most things slide when it comes to dining, but the server clearly needed a refresher in customer service. He was rude! It was almost as though it was my fault for coming and giving the place business!   Much like the service, the food was also lacking. The baba ganoush was more smokey than most barbecue joints. Very overpowering. The same went for the falafel; a little too heavy on the cinnamon for my liking. It was like eating a confused zucchini cake. This was my first and definitely last time eating at Zeitouni Grill.

YDum9-kwqiPQ3tUD8XP5FQ.text: This small place is a Mecca for Lebanese food. Great taste and flavor with a friendly staff to greet you. The food is always fresh and rich, I would highly recommend their tawook speciality sandwich and their falafel platter.

Overall I will visit the restaurant again.

3hyaKg6KwK3Cv9xQ2R9P5w.text: Trust me when I say to get the chicken special. It is hands down my favorite sandwich in Charlotte. Amazing!

I wouldn't come back though. Although the food is good, they give you small portions for the amount that they charge. I can go else where for larger portion and same price. Nothing really strikes an interest for me.

0T1xa_tY4Yb-39uYA9tdGw.text: Ordered a Mediterranean salad. Expected green leafy lettuce. Received iceberg. Dressing was very salty. Very under-whelmed. The place was clean. And the gentlemen taking the orders was very nice

lBp7ZoceWSj915Et7TmDlw.text: Way over priced, portions are small and quality is meh. We ordered the Mediterranean salad and was so disappointed with it! No pita bread, 2 olives, 3/4 of one slice of a cucumber, 1/2 of a slice of green pepper and 2 tablespoons of feta! This was their 'large' Mediterranean salad for $4.99. The gyro had two small pieces of lamb inside a big pita with sparce traces of feta. Luckily we bought the appetizer of 6 Grape Leaves (that were floating in olive oil), they were very good and luckily helped fill us up. Save your money and try one of the many Ballantyne area restaurants that will satisfy you for your hard earned money! Sorry Zeitouni Grill, we really want to like you but after several visits its just not worth the money!

YF5m29988WH85WyT6eWtIw.text: Saw all the review buzz and made a special trip this way just to see what the fuss was all about. Sad to say, it was more hype than the quality and experience I was hoping to find.   Husband and I each ordered the Vegetarian Mezza platter. I had the babba ghanouj and the Mediterranean salad and he got the one with hummus and tabbouleh. The grape leaves were the most disappointing item on the platter. For a restaurant that prides itself on freshness, the grape leaves were canned! When I'm in a pinch, I'll grab a can of stuffed grape leaves...so I'm quite familiar with the green oily look left on my plate. The tabbouleh wasn't that great either. Oh, how unfortunate! However, the potatoes were seasoned well, the pita bread was fresh, and the falafel was good.   On the bright side, the Turkish coffee was made fresh to order and paired nicely with the baklava. I highly recommend getting the two. In addition, the employees were very friendly and the space was small, very casual, and clean.   While I made a special trip this time, I don't see myself doing it again. However, I'm not entirely opposed to stopping in if I'm in the area, especially to get my Turkish coffee and baklava combo fix.

ZgEYkBI7lhz77eQpOPLKdg.text: Fresh amazing food very clean and precise in taste , it did take a few minutes for the food to come out, but it was an amazing experience.

1wIoZZrDjgFKlt7sxNJwJA.text: The best falafel and hummus I've had outside of Turkey (the country that is)!  I'd love to expound on all the wonderful flavors and how their decore is this or that...but simply...the food is great and exactly what it should taste like.  If you care about the ambiance and whether it's worth a 40 minute drive or not, defer to the other reviews.  The falafel sandwich alone gets five stars from me.  I do know this:  If I'm in the area, I'd be hard-pressed to choose another location for lunch.

iss46dmR-MvVpVDjccCRrg.text: Love the chicken pita here. Great little cucumber salad and hummus on the side. Awesome for a quick bite.

UfdAaVZlrsF5ALnOm7PgaA.text: The gyro didn't taste authentic! I did not like the tzatziki sauce flavor!!!! It taste like they squeezed to extra lemon juice (not lime) into the sauce. I think the entire Gyro would've been better with a traditional flavored tzatziki sauce. The gyro was not bad but wasn't that good!  Overall, I would visit this place again but try something else on the menu!

EpbQ6K0lpZXLpBwTUa2y-w.text: Saw the Yelp reviews and decided to try this place. I got the Falafel platter with Baba Ghanouj & Fatoush. It came with their pita and tahini for the Falafel. Everything was perfectly seasoned and delicious... Even eaten as take out. Nice casual atmosphere with friendly service and great prices. This is easily one of the best meals I've had in Charlotte and can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

2XeLdZRaITOmVE557c1x8A.text: I set high expectations for this place due to my desire for great Mediterranean and the Mediterranean food that I've eaten in the past paired with the phenomenal reviews and ratings I've read and heard.  Don't get me wrong, food and experience was good and I'll be returning or considering it again in the future, but it won't be my go to spot or "gotta have it again tomorrow."   I ordered the falafel platter. One of my choice extras was a Mediterranean salad- which was quite tasty, but was disappointed in the size. I was expecting a side salad portion, but in reality it was a to-go side in the meal container...so probably 5 small to medium bites. For my second option my choices were baba ghanoush (eggplant) or hummus. I opted for the baba, when I opened the platter I assumed they just gave me hummus because it was the consistency and color of hummus, but didn't taste like baba or hummus.. So I'm not sure what that was. That item was my least favorite. Now to the falafel! It was quite good. I enjoyed the seasoning and flavors, perhaps I tasted some mint. Very enjoyable! It came accompanied by some pita bread.   I also asked when ordering to make sure the yogurt cucumber sauce was in the platter on the falafel, they insured that it was included. No such sauce.. And that sauce is my fav. There was some tahini, which was good.  My co-worker ordered the grape leaves appetizer. They were presented well and she liked them.  Customer service and timeliness was excellent. Wassim rang up my order, no extra surprises. The bill matched what was quoted on the phone when I placed the order for pick-up. They are open until 9pm. It is close to my job. The restaurant is set-up cafe style. Bathroom was clean and stocked.   For any interested, they are currently hiring. Seek within.

ZetOk_nqQnBY2ytK6yUdTA.text: This one of my favorite places to eat.  My daughter and I go almost once a week. Everything is so yummy!!!!

MPrT_pryzO63WP9xxpc8JA.text: Stop by this place to grab a quick bite to eat while traveling for work because it was across the street from my hotel.  I got a GYROS & a CHICKEN GYRO, both of which were fresh and tasty.     Good Job...Quick, fresh and tasty Gyros are always a win in my box.

j3VH0zYPK92Oe5DUVKB52w.text: This place cooks to your order (even the Lebanese coffee1) and you will have to wait for 10 minutes or longer but I assure you, you will definitely feel it's worth the wait. My favorite here is shish Tawooq Platter with two sides (Tabbouleh & Babba Ghanouj). The skewered chicken is so flavorful, Tabbouleh is so fresh and babba ghanouj so delicious! It's a wonderful and perfect meal!

-xrpstpHtirTQsPIvJuMWQ.text: Had lunch here and really enjoyed it. Had the chicken kabob pita, potatoes harra and stuffed grape leaves. The potatoes were outstanding and the chicken was well seasoned and grilled to perfection. Was not a fan of the grape leaves, but I have never really liked them in the past. photos.caption: Photo of Zeitouni Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

iJBSmgSZhzK7OizxYd_7-w.text: This place is great. The marinated chicken kebabs are great! The service is always good and the food comes out pretty quickly if it's not too busy.

3fNiLecD-lmp-tyMUkxzjQ.text: Updated: Even walking in near closing time, I still get the same great service. I can't add anything to my earlier review. I'm lucky to now live close by.   I'll come in here as often as I can and make sure to get extra to eat at dinner, too!!   This is still my favorite spot for some quick authentic Mediterranean fare, after over 2 years of coming here.  I had lunch with a friend here today, and it was so good I'm craving it for dinner!  The baba ganouj (eggplant dip) as well as the chicken in my salad had yummy wonderful smoky flavor a from their wood grill.  I almost always get the same things, baba ganouj and either a Mediterranean salad with a chicken skewer for the perfect lunch or for something larger, the chicken gyros sandwich.   Also wonderful are the tabouli salad and hummus.  All the sauces, dips, and dressings are freshly made and full of flavor, and the meats are juicy and flavorful as well.   Anyone I've brought here has loved it as well.  The atmosphere is casual and full of light. A great place to meet with friends, take the kids, or bring a book and eat on your own.  I've done it all and felt equally comfortable doing it all. Highly recommended!

t0P4ATl_dUDDid2ipHvxcA.text: After driving way out of my way to try this "restaurant" I was disappointed to find instead a lunch counter located in a generic store-front space of a generic strip mall with a wide open, panoramic view on two whole walls of ... the freaking parking lot!   To boot it was a rainy day which made the locale even more depressing. This place doesn't even have the charm of a dive because like much of Charlotte it's all brand spanking new.   The choices on the menu were limited, we ordered a few of our usual. The food was very good, as good as can expected for this type of place. I thought the prices were maybe a little high (for the venue) but not too bad. The service was unexpectedly slow but very friendly, we weren't in a hurry anyway. I'm deducting one star for the fast food cafeteria dining experience.   My constructive criticism of the day : get some window treatment, such as cafe curtains. Neither the view of the parking lot nor of the counter are much fun.
